member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Mapping.Map.SaveAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Save any changes that have been made to the map to the associated PortalItem.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous save operation.
member.remarks:
Asynchronous method to save any changes that have been made to the map. The map must have been constructed using the Map(PortalItem) constructor to associate it with a PortalItem object, and must be loaded.
Updates the map content data on the portal and also updates the portal item properties stored on the portal to match those stored within the map's PortalItem object.
member.param: Flag to indicate whether the map should be saved to the supported webmap version that the API supports (see system requirements). This may cause data loss as unknown data is not saved. If true, unknown data will be removed and the map will be saved. If false, the operation will fail if the map contains unknown data that will not be saved. This flag can be used to provide a warning to users that some map data may be lost when the map is saved.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Mapping.Map.SaveAsync(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Save any changes that have been made to the map to the associated PortalItem.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous save operation.
member.remarks:
Asynchronous method to save any changes that have been made to the map allowing cancellation. The map must have been constructed using the Map(PortalItem) constructor to associate it with a PortalItem object, and must be loaded.
Updates the map content data on the portal and also updates the portal item properties stored on the portal to match those stored within the map's PortalItem object.
member.param: Flag to indicate whether the map should be saved to the supported webmap version that the API supports (see system requirements). This may cause data loss as unknown data is not saved. If true, unknown data will be removed and the map will be saved. If false, the operation will fail if the map contains unknown data that will not be saved. This flag can be used to provide a warning to users that some map data may be lost when the map is saved.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Mapping.Map.SaveAsAsync(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.ArcGISPortal,Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalFolder,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Uri,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Save the map to a new PortalItem.
member.remarks:
Asynchronous method to save a map as a new portal item. The map does not need to be associated with an existing PortalItem object. The map must be loaded. The result is a reference to the new PortalItem which the map is now associated with.
Note that if the map was already associated with a PortalItem object (either because the map was created using a PortalItem or was previously saved), that object will be replaced with a new PortalItem, effectively duplicating the map on the portal.
member.param: Flag to indicate whether the map should be saved to the supported webmap version that the API supports (see system requirements). This may cause data loss as unknown data is not saved. If true, unknown data will be removed and the map will be saved. If false, the operation will fail if the map contains unknown data that will not be saved. This flag can be used to provide a warning to users that some map data may be lost when the map is saved.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous save as operation. The value of the task result is a object.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Mapping.Map.SaveAsAsync(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.ArcGISPortal,Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalFolder,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Uri,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Save the map to a new PortalItem.
member.remarks:
Asynchronous method to save a map as a new portal item allowing cancellation. The map does not need to be associated with an existing PortalItem object. The map must be loaded. The result is a reference to the new PortalItem which the map is now associated with.
Note that if the map was already associated with a PortalItem object (either because the map was created using a PortalItem or was previously saved), that object will be replaced with a new PortalItem, effectively duplicating the map on the portal.
member.param: Flag to indicate whether the map should be saved to the supported webmap version that the API supports (see system requirements). This may cause data loss as unknown data is not saved. If true, unknown data will be removed and the map will be saved. If false, the operation will fail if the map contains unknown data that will not be saved. This flag can be used to provide a warning to users that some map data may be lost when the map is saved.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous save as operation. The value of the task result is a object.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Mapping.Map.Clone
member.summary: Clones this instance of the map and its members.
member.returns: A copy of the map.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Mapping.Map.UnknownJson
member.summary: UnknownJson is a dictionary of JSON strings that will be persisted in the document.
member.value: The unknown JSON objects stored in the map.
member.remarks: The unknown JSON is JSON not yet supported by the ArcGIS Runtime but is part of the known WebMap Specification, and can be accessed by 3rd party applications that need to use this extra information. Any JSON in this collection will be retained during a save. Code relying on data in UnknownJson should be resilient against data no longer available in future updates, where support gets added and this data gets parsed and moved into public properties.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Mapping.Map.UnsupportedJson
member.summary: Gets the unsupported data from the webmap source JSON. This data will be lost if the webmap gets saved back to json
member.value: The unsupported JSON objects stored in the map.
member.remarks: The contents of unsupported json allows apps to access any custom JSON that isn't part of the known webmap specification and couldn't be validated against the JSON Schema. Any data in here will be lost if you save the map. JSON that the runtime doesn't support but is part of the JSON Schema will be available in the .

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.ArcGISPortal
member.summary: The ArcGISPortal class is part of the Portal API which provides a way to build applications that work with content from ArcGIS Online or an ArcGIS Portal.

remarks.para: ArcGIS Portal is software technology from Esri that customers can deploy either on premise or in the cloud. ArcGIS Online is Esri's Software as a Service offering that represents GIS as a Service and is implemented using the same technology as ArcGIS Portal. The Portal API allows application developers to work with users, groups and content hosted within ArcGIS Online or within an ArcGIS Portal. The API allows developers to build web, mobile, and desktop applications that support sharing and collaboration using web maps. Organizational developers can also use the API to build custom applications for their users. The Portal class provides the connection information to the portal (Uri, Token, ClientAppType, CultureInfo). Once instantiated by calling the static factory , and are available and provide information about the portal and the current user.
This class is needed to instantiate all others classes of the Portal library.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.ArcGISPortal.FindGroupsAsync(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters)
member.summary: Finds portal groups from a query string.

remarks.para: This method obtains a object. Use the property to get the collection of objects.

objects are collections (aka. groups) of items, usually related to a specific area of interest such as maps, applications, and tools. Groups allow members to contribute items as a useful way to collaborate. This method allows searching for specific groups within ArcGIS Online (AGOL) or ArcGIS Portal and requires providing specific to limit the scope of which groups are returned.

You do not have to be a logged in user to get information from this method. You can gain this information from anonymous access. However, to obtain information about groups in your organization that have a level of Private you need to use the by supplying the appropriate username/password credentials.

By default the property that is used by this method uses a default set of high performance index fields when providing simple keyword string(s) for the search. As of AGOL/ArcGIS Portal v2.1, these fields are: id, title, description, snippet, tags, and owner. For more advanced searches, developers can preface their simple keyword strings with a more exhaustive set of REST named fields followed by a colon (:). These advanced searches can also take advantage of Boolean operators (AND, NOT, OR, +), wildcard operators (* and ?), as well as other techniques to more fully utilize the AGOL/ArcGIS Portal search capabilities. Comprehensive details on using the advanced search strings that follow the REST specification can be found in the Search Reference document in the ArcGIS Portal API.
The following are a few advanced REST search scenarios with example strings that you might consider using for the property:

To find one specific PortalGroup by it's Id: "id:1db70a32f5f84ea9a88f5f460f22557b"
To find all Private PortalGroups with the word 'federal' in the Title field: "title:federal AND access:private"
To find all PortalGroups with the word 'federal' in the Title field and the word 'restricted' in the Description field: "title:federal AND description:restricted"
To find all PortalGroups with the word 'state' in the Title field and not have the word 'restricted' in the Description field: "title:state NOT description:restricted"

NOTE: It is not required to use the advanced REST search syntax to find PortalGroups with this Method. Simple string syntax for the Portal.SearchParameters.QueryString Property such as: "federal" will find all occurrences of that string in the default high performance index fields.

member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous find groups operation. The value of the task result is a .

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.ArcGISPortal.FindGroupsAsync(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Finds portal groups from a query string.

remarks.para: This method obtains a object. Use the property to get the collection of objects.

objects are collections (aka. groups) of items, usually related to a specific area of interest such as maps, applications, and tools. Groups allow members to contribute items as a useful way to collaborate. This method allows searching for specific groups within ArcGIS Online (AGOL) or ArcGIS Portal and requires providing specific to limit the scope of which groups are returned.

You do not have to be a logged in user to get information from this method. You can gain this information from anonymous access. However, to obtain information about groups in your organization that have a level of Private you need to use the AuthenticationManager by supplying the appropriate username/password credentials.

By default the property that is used by this method uses a default set of high performance index fields when providing simple keyword string(s) for the search. As of AGOL/ArcGIS Portal v2.1, these fields are: id, title, description, snippet, tags, and owner. For more advanced searches, developers can preface their simple keyword strings with a more exhaustive set of REST named fields followed by a colon (:). These advanced searches can also take advantage of Boolean operators (AND, NOT, OR, +), wildcard operators (* and ?), as well as other techniques to more fully utilize the AGOL/ArcGIS Portal search capabilities. Comprehensive details on using the advanced search strings that follow the REST specification can be found in the Search Reference document in the ArcGIS Portal API.
The following are a few advanced REST search scenarios with example strings that you might consider using for the property:

To find one specific PortalGroup by it's Id: "id:1db70a32f5f84ea9a88f5f460f22557b"
To find all Private PortalGroups with the word 'federal' in the Title field: "title:federal AND access:private"
To find all PortalGroups with the word 'federal' in the Title field and the word 'restricted' in the Description field: "title:federal AND description:restricted"
To find all PortalGroups with the word 'state' in the Title field and not have the word 'restricted' in the Description field: "title:state NOT description:restricted"

NOTE: It is not required to use the advanced REST search syntax to find PortalGroups with this Method. Simple string syntax for the Portal.SearchParameters.QueryString Property such as: "federal" will find all occurrences of that string in the default high performance index fields.

member.param: A with which to cancel the operation if required.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous find groups operation. The value of the task result is a .

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.ArcGISPortal.FindUsersAsync(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters)
member.summary: Finds portal users from a query string.

remarks.para: This method obtains a object that contains objects. Use the property to get the collection of objects.

objects are user accounts within ArcGIS Online (AGOL) or ArcGIS Portal. Users add content to AGOL/ArcGIS Portal in the form of maps, tools, and applications. This method allows searching for specific user accounts within ArcGIS Online (AGOL) or ArcGIS Portal and requires providing specific to limit the scope of which users are returned.

You do not have to be a logged in user to get information from this method. You can gain this information from anonymous access. However, to obtain information about users in your organization that have a level of Private you need to use the AuthenticationManager by supplying the appropriate username/password credentials.

NOTE: While the method does return an collection of objects as result of the search operation, not all of the properties of the objects will contain data. This is by design to protect certain confidential information about a user.

member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous search users operation.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.ArcGISPortal.FindItemsAsync(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters)
member.summary: Finds portal items from a query string.

remarks.para: This method obtains a object that contains objects. Use the property to get the collection of objects.

Portal.PortalItem objects are user items, usually related to a specific area of interest such as maps, applications, and tools. This method allows searching for specific items within ArcGIS Online (AGOL) or ArcGIS Portal by providing to limit the scope of which items are returned.

You do not have to be a logged in user to get information from this method. You can gain this information from anonymous access. However, to obtain information about items that have a level of Private you need to use the AuthenticationManager by supplying the appropriate username/password credentials.

By default the property that is used in this method uses a default set of high performance index fields when providing simple keyword string(s) for the search. As of AGOL/ArcGIS Portal v2.1, these fields are: title, tags, snippet, description, accessinformation, spatialreference, type and typekeywords. For more advanced searches, developers can preface their simple keyword strings with a more exhaustive set of REST named fields followed by a colon (:). These advanced searches can also take advantage of Boolean operators (AND, NOT, OR, +), wildcard operators (* and ?), as well as other techniques to more fully utilize the AGOL/ArcGIS Portal search capabilities. Comprehensive details on using the advanced search strings that follow the REST specification can be found in the Search Reference document in the ArcGIS Portal API.
The following are a few advanced REST search scenarios with example strings that you might consider using for the property:

To find one specific PortalItem by it's Id: "id:00e5e70929e14055ab686df16c842ec1"
To find all WebMap PortalItems with the word 'florida' in the Title field: "title:florida AND type:web map"
To find all Layer Package PortalItems with the word 'florida' in the Title field: "title:florida AND type:layer package"
To find all PortalItems with the word 'florida' in the Title field and the word 'esri' in the LicenseInfo field: "title:florida AND licenseinfo:esri"
To find all PortalItems with the word 'florida' in the Title field and not have the word 'esri' in the LicenseInfo field: "title:florida NOT licenseinfo:esri"
To find all PortalItems with located within a specific spatial extent and the word 'esri' in the LicenseInfo: "extent:[-114.3458, 21.7518] - [-73.125, 44.0658] AND licenseinfo:esri"
To find all PortalItems with a SpatialReference.WKID of 4267: "spatialreference:4267"
To find all PortalItems with a SpatialReference.WKID of 4267 or have the word 'cancer' in the Title field: "spatialreference:4267 OR title:cancer"

NOTE: It is not required to use the advanced REST search syntax to find PortalItems with this method. Simple string syntax for the property such as: "florida" will find all occurrences of that string in the default high performance index fields.

member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous search items operation. The value of the task result is a object.

remarks.para: The purpose of this Method is to obtain that belong to a particular authenticated user for nested sub-folders in their ArcGIS Online (AGOL) and ArcGIS Portal account. This method performs an asynchronous request to obtain an IEnumerable of objects for the credentialed logged in user. You cannot use anonymous access to obtain a object and use this Method to obtain valid results. As AGOL/ArcGIS Portal require the use of long term tokens to access secured user information.

It is a recommended best practice to call one of the ArcGISPortal.CreateAsync Methods to initialize the Portal.ArcGISPortal object such that the credentialed Portal.ArcGISPortal.CurrentUser can be obtained. Then for the credentialed user, call the Method to obtain an IEnumerable of Portal.ArcGISPortalFolder objects for which this Method can be used. It is not recommended to try an obtain Portal.ArcGISPortalUser objects via the following Methods and Properties, because the returned users are not authenticated credentialed users and you will not be able to obtain sub-folder information: and .
To obtain objects that exist at the root level of the user account on AGOL/ArcGIS Portal use the method.

member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous get items operation. The value of the task result contains a collection of objects.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalGroup
member.summary: Represents a group within the portal (e.g., "San Bernardino Fires" ).

remarks.para: The owner is automatically an administrator and is returned in the list of admins. The visibility of the group to other users is determined by the access property. If the group is private no one except the administrators and the members of the group will be able to see it. If the group is shared with an organization, then all members of the organization will be able to find the group.

Administrators can invite, add to or remove members from a group as well as update or delete the group. The administrator for an organization may also reassign the group to another member of the organization. Group members may leave the group. Authenticated users may apply to join a group.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether members of the organization can share resources outside of the organization.
member.value: true if the members of the organization can share outside of the organization; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalInfo.CanShareBingPublic
member.summary: Gets the a flag indicating whether the bing key can be shared to the public and will be returned as part of a description. This requires the 'access' of the portal/org to be set to 'public'. The CanShareBingPublic property is not returned publicly but only shown to users within the organization.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalInfo.CanSearchPublic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether members of the organization can search outside of the organization. When true, public items, groups and users are included in search queries. When false, no public items outside of the organization are included. However, public items which are part of the organization are included.
member.value: true if the members of the organization can search outside of the organization; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalInfo.FeaturedItemsGroupQuery
member.summary: Gets the query used to determine which group should drive the gallery of featured items displayed in the client application for the specified culture. The query specified in this setting should be used as the query string parameter for a call to the groups. The first group returned should be selected. If the selected group has a null featuredItemsId property then the client should display the items that are shared with the group. If the featuredItemsId is non-null then the client should display the items that are related to the featured items item

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalInfo.BasemapGalleryGroupQuery
member.summary: Gets the query used to determine which group should drive the gallery of basemaps displayed in the client application for the specified culture. The query specified in this setting should be used as the query string parameter for a call to the groups. The first group returned should be selected, and those items shared with the group should be displayed in the client’s basemap gallery (if applicable). Ex: "title:'ArcGIS Online Basemaps' AND owner:esri"

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalInfo.HomePageFeaturedContentGroupQuery
member.summary: Gets the query used to determine which group should drive the featured content displayed on the home page of client application for the specified culture. The query specified in this setting should be used as the query string parameter for a call to the groups. The first group returned should be selected, and those items shared with the group should be displayed in the home page gallery. Ex: "title:'Featured Maps' AND owner:esri" For a logged in user who is part of an organization this property will always be set from the account properties and will be null if not set by the organizational account administrators.
member.value: The homepage featured content query.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalInfo.FeaturedGroupsQueries
member.summary: Gets the featured groups to possibly display on the group page or to feature for an organization.
member.remarks: This property returns a collection of group query strings that can be used to find featured groups for an organization.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalItem
member.summary: Represents an item (a unit of content) in the portal. An item may have associated binary or textual data which is available via the . For example an item of type map package returns the actual bits corresponding to the map package via the item data resource.

remarks.para: ArcGISPortal Class is the gateway to build applications with Esri's cloud infrastructure of ArcGIS Online or ArcGIS Portal. ArcGIS Portal is software technology from Esri that customers can deploy either on premise or in the cloud. ArcGIS Online is Esri's Software as a Service offering that represents GIS as a Service and is implemented using the same technology as ArcGIS Portal. The classes in the Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal namespace allow developers to work with users, groups and content hosted within ArcGIS Online or within an ArcGIS Portal.
A is an item of content in the ArcGISPortal Class. There are several ways to obtain an PortalItem via the Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal Assembly; they include:

list.item: Method
Method

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalItem.Access
member.summary: Gets or sets the access level on the item. Private is the default and only the item owner can access. Shared allows the item to be shared with a specific group. Setting to Organization restricts item access to members of your organization. If Public, all users can access the item.

remarks.para: A can be accessed by various types of users. There are four levels of access that can be associated with a . Some of the access levels can be concurrent, others cannot. The Property however only returns a single PortalAccess level enumeration even though multiple levels of access may have been specified via the and/or Methods. If multiple access levels have been specified on a , the returned access level from the Property will be the least restrictive access level. The following diagram illustrates the hierarchy of access levels:

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalItem.ShareWithAsync(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shares the portal item with everyone or just with the user's organization. If both 'everyone' and 'organization' arguments are true, the item will be shared with everyone (). If both 'everyone' and 'organization' arguments are false, the item will be made private, unless the item has been shared with one or more groups. In that case, the items property will be set to . The groups an item has been shared with are not affected by this method. This Method is available only to authenticated users.
member.para: In order to use a user must be logged into the portal site with proper credentials.
The individual who is authenticated and logged into the portal site that desires to use to establish which Groups (via their values) the PortalItem is part of MUST meet one of the following criteria:

list.item: The authenticated user is the owner of the PortalItem.
The authenticated user is the Administrator of the Organization to which the PortalItem belongs.

The PortalItem has its value of Public and the authenticated user is the owner of the Group. Note: the PortalItem may not have been created/owned by the authenticated user; it is only important that the PortalItem be Public, no matter who created/owns the PortalItem.

The PortalItem has its PortalAccess value of Public and the authenticated user is the Administrator of the Organization to which Group belongs. Note: the PortalItem may not have been created/owned by the authenticated user; it is only important that the PortalItem be Public, no matter who created/owns the PortalItem.

member.param: If true, this item will be shared with everyone, for example, it will be publicly accessible. If false, the item will not be shared with the public.
If true, this item will be shared with the organization. If false, the item will not be shared with the organization.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous share operation.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalItem.ShareWithGroupsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalGroup})
member.summary: Shares this PortalItem with the specified list of . This Method is available only to authenticated users.

remarks.para: In order to use the PortalItem.ShareAsync Method, a user must be logged into the ArcGIS Online or ArcGIS Portal site with proper credentials.

The individual who is authenticated and logged into the portal site that desires to use the PortalItem.ShareAsync Method to establish which Groups (via their values) the PortalItem is part of MUST meet one of the following criteria:

list.item: The authenticated user is the owner of the PortalItem.
The authenticated user is the Administrator of the Organization to which the PortalItem belongs.

The PortalItem has its value of Public and the authenticated user is the owner of the Group. Note: the PortalItem may not have been created/owned by the authenticated user; it is only important that the PortalItem be Public, no matter who created/owns the PortalItem.

The PortalItem has its PortalAccess value of Public and the authenticated user is the Administrator of the Organization to which Group belongs. Note: the PortalItem may not have been created/owned by the authenticated user; it is only important that the PortalItem be Public, no matter who created/owns the PortalItem.

remarks.para: NOTE: Setting the first parameter (groupIds) of the PortalItem.ShareAsync to null/Nothing does not set any existing Group values. In other words, it does not empty the list of Groups associated with the PortalItem. The way to remove existing Group values from the PortalItem is to use the method.

Using this version of the PortalItem.ShareAsync only modifies Groups for the PortalAccess level of Shared. If it is desired to add or change the other PortalAccess levels for the PortalItem, consider using the other version: .

member.param: The collection of groups to share the item with.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous share operation. The value of the task result is a collection of objects with which the item was NOT shared.

member.summary: Updates this portal item's properties on the portal asynchronously. This update item operation allows users to update item information without changing the item content. Users can use this operation to update item information such as the title, description, tags, thumbnail, etc. This call is available to the item owner and the administrator of the organization.
member.remark: Before calling this method, the portal item must have been updated in memory by using the property setters such as , , etc.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous update operation.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalUser.AddPortalItemAsync(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalItem)
member.summary: Adds an item without content asynchronously. This operation is available only to authenticated users.

remarks.para: The user automatically becomes the owner of the item. The item by default is flagged as private (e.g., not shared with any group). This can be changed with the share item operation.
The url used for an item must be unique within the particular user's folder.

member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous add item operation. The value of the task result is a object.
member.exception: Operation is available only to authenticated users.

member.exception: Operation is available only to authenticated users.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalUser.GetContentAsync
member.summary: Gets the folders and items that are stored at the user's root folder.

remarks.para: The purpose of this Method is to obtain content (items and folders) that belong to a particular authenticated user in a poratl. This method performs an asynchronous request to obtain a object for the logged in user. You cannot use anonymous access to obtain a Portal.PortalUser object and use this Method to obtain valid results. As AGOL/ArcGIS Portal require the use of long term tokens to access secured user information.
To retrieve portal items from folders other than the root use .

member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous get items operation. The value of the task result contains a object.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.HelperServices
member.summary: Various services needed by clients.

remarks.para: This class contains properties to obtain information (most importantly the Url) for various special asynchronous web services available on ArcGIS Online (AGOL) or ArcGIS Portal. The HelperServices.GeocodeServices Property provides information for geocoding (aka. locator) tasks. The HelperServices.GeometryService Property provides information for various geometry tasks (for example: buffer, project, intersect, etc.). The HelperServices.PrintTaskService Property provides information for printing tasks. The HelperServices.RouteService Property provides information for routing tasks. To obtain a Portal.HelperServices object, use the Portal.ArcGISPortalInfo.HelperServices Property.

You do not have to be a logged in user using the AuthenticationManager to get information for the object. You can gain this information from anonymous access. However, to obtain information about the Portal.ArcGISPortalInfo object that has a level of Private or Shared you need to use the AuthenticationManager by supplying the appropriate username/password credentials.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters.Query
member.summary: Gets or sets the query string to search against.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters.SortField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field to sort by. (e.g for groups the allowed field names are title, owner, and created).

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters.SortOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether order returns in ascending or descending order. Default is ascending.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters.StartIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the first entry in the result set response. The index number is 1-based. The default value of is 1 (e.g.,. the first search result). The start index, along with the parameter can be used to paginate the search results.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters.Limit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of results to be included in the result set response. The default value is 10 and the maximum allowed value is 100. The start index, along with the limit parameter can be used to paginate the search results. The actual number of returned results may be less than . This happens when the number of results remaining after is less than .

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters.CanSearchPublic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether public items outside the organization may be included in the search results. Default behavior is they are included.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Portal.PortalQueryParameters.BoundingBox
member.summary: Gets or sets the search extent for a spatial search. Search requires a bounding box, a , or both. Spatial search is an overlaps/intersects function of the search extent and the extent of the document. Sorting in a spatial search is not supported. Documents that have no extent (e.g., mxds, 3dds, lyr) will not be found when doing a spatial search. Document extent is assumed to be in geographic coordinates.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Security.AuthenticationManager
member.summary:
The Authentication Manager is a singleton class that, when enabled, will manage the user credentials for the following resources:
ArcGIS Server resources secured using token-based authentication or using HTTP authentication. Note that only ArcGIS Server versions 10 SP 1 and greater are supported.
Secured ArcGIS.com resources (e.g. web maps).
Secured ArcGIS Portal resources.
A credential for accessing to an ArcGIS resource can be preset by using . In this case the credential is used for any requests to the specified resources.
If a request to an ArcGIS resource returns an authorization error, the , if not null, is called. This challenge handler can return the credential for accessing to the resource.
If the ChallengeHandler is null or if it doesn't return any credential, the Authorization error is returned to the caller as if the request was executed out of the AuthenticationManager.
member.remarks: Most generally the ChallengeHandler displays the UI allowing the user to enter the username/password for accessing the resource. Unlike for WinStore application, the API doesn't provide any default UI for WinPhone or Desktop. However, a default challenge handler is set for managing the access though OAuth when the is set.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Security.AuthenticationManager.Current
member.summary: Gets the single instance. This is the only way to get an IdentifyManager instance.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Security.AuthenticationManager.ChallengeHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the component that handles the authorization errors in order to get a valid credential object.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Security.AuthenticationManager.RegisterServer(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Security.ServerInfo)
member.summary: Register secure servers and the token endpoints. The Authentication Manager makes its best guess to determine the location of the secure server and token endpoint so in most cases calling registerServers is not necessary. However if the location of your server or token endpoint is non-standard use this method to register the location. Additionally if portal uses the OAuth authentication, it neeeds to be registered by this method.
member.param: The serverInfo object that defines the secure service and token endpoint.
member.remarks: Most generally, the AuthenticationManager can guess the token endpoint whether the url contains either '/sharing' (portal url) or '/rest/services' (arcgis service).

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Security.AuthenticationManager.OAuthAuthorizeHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the component sets the component that handles authorization by a resource owner in an oauth workflow.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Security.AuthenticationManager.TokenValidity
member.summary: Gets or sets the default suggested lifetime of the token in minutes. This default value can be overridden for a specific credential by setting .
member.remarks: With the OAuth authorization grant workflow, you can generate a permanent OAuth refresh token by specifying -1 as token validity. If you don’t specify a token validity the default refresh token validity is 2 weeks.
member.value: The default token validity.

member.summary: Generates a token credential object asynchronously. You need to provide the service URI, the username and the password. This is a helper method typically called by the UI challenging the user.

member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous generate credential operation. The value of the task result is a object.

member.param: The optional infos concerning the token to generate (referer, credentials).
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous generate credential operation. The value of the task result is a object.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Security.AuthenticationManager.GetCredentialAsync(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Security.CredentialRequestInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a Credential object of the specified type (credentialRequestInfo.AuthenticationType) that can be used to access the secured resource identified by the input url (credentialRequestInfo.Url). If required, the challenge method will be called and should return the expected credential object. If case of Token AuthenticationType, the user is typically challenged for a username and password which are used to generate a token. This method is typically called internally when a request fails due to an "invalid credentials" error.
member.param: The information about the credential to get.
Indicates if the method should make additional attempts to get the credentials after a failure (i.e. if true, the challenge method will be called in any case)
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous get credential operation. The value of the task result is a object.

member.summary: Search parameters used to search for symbol primitives in a SymbolDictionary.
member.remarks:
StyleSymbolSearchParameters allow you to specify different parameters when searching a symbol dictionary with
For example, you may want to search for any symbols where the category is "2", the name contains "destroyed", and the tags contain "Protection Lines". You need to pass this handle to all style symbol search parameters functions. This object allows you to set the parameters inorder to perform a search on symbol dictionary.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Symbology.DictionarySymbolStyle
member.summary: A symbol dictionary object.

remarks.para: A Symbol Dictionary can be used in conjunction with a applied to a or .

When used by itself, the Symbol Dictionary supports two key workflows. The first is to find a symbol with provided attributes values. This is done by creating a map of field names and attribute values (as determined by the associated specification), and passing those into findSymbol, which returns a new CimSymbol. In this case, the key is the name of the specification field (e.g. "symbolset" in the case of mil2525d), and the value is value you want associated with that field (e.g "Atmospheric"). You might use this symbol to create a new Graphic.

You can also use a standalone SymbolDictionary to search for symbol primitives. Symbol primitives are the individual symbols that make up more complex and advanced multilayer military symbols. This is achieved using . You could create a symbol picker app that searches for all symbols that have the tag "maritime" in it. The search results contain CIM symbols which you could then either use as they are or extract from them different individual symbols to create a new composite symbol.You need to pass this handle to all symbol dictionary functions. This object talks to rule engines to generate symbols and search symbols specific to the standard. A SymbolDictionary is made up of a *.stylx file (a sqlite database from ArcGIS Pro), which contains the symbol primitives for a given symbology specification (such as mil2525d), as well as a rule engine that parses input fields. The SymbolDictionary assembles new symbols from the input attributes, and can also apply geometry manipulations to the symbols in the case of multipoint geometries.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Symbology.DictionaryRenderer
member.summary: A Dictionary Renderer object.

remarks.para: The SymbolDictionary is created using a given specification such as "mil2525d". Each specification depends on attribute names that define the symbology and text of each feature. For example, the mil2525d specification looks for attributes named "identity", "symbolset", "symbolentity", and "modifier1", among many others. These attributes reference different symbols in the style file that are assembled to create a unique symbol. In order to display features using the DictionaryRenderer, you must make sure the DictionaryRenderer and associated SymbolDictionary know which attributes in your data to use. This can be achieved in multiple ways:

- Pre-author your data so that the attribute names match the attributes needed by the specification. In the case of the mil2525d specification, author a feature service (or other data source) with a field named "identity", another named "symbolset", and so on. In this scenario, you create a FeatureTable from the source data, create a FeatureLayer from the FeatureTable, apply the DictionaryRenderer to the FeatureLayer, and the symbols are generated automatically and applied to the layer in the map. The same workflow applies for Graphics in a GraphicsOverlay. Ideally when creating graphics on the fly, you can give the attributes names that match the specification. When fields in the FeatureTable and attributes in Graphics have expected names, the DictionaryRenderer automatically finds them.

- Manually map your attribute names to those expected by the specification. You can map as many attribute names as necessary for the specification, but only need to map attribute names that do not match the specification (all matching attribute names will be automatically matched by the renderer). For example, an expected attribute "symbolset" might appear as the "symbol_set" field in your FeatureTable. In this scenario, you can create a ServiceFeatureTable from a feature service, create a FeatureLayer from that feature table, create a DictionaryRenderer by manually mapping the "symbol_set" name to the "symbolset" name expected by the specification, and finally apply the renderer to the FeatureLayer.

A DictionaryRenderer can be applied to pre-authored data, such as feature services, mobile geodatabases (generated from ArcMap or a sync-enabled feature service), and feature layers in a mobile map package. You can also apply it to a GraphicsOverlay, which allow for on-the-fly graphic generation.

The DictionaryRenderer uses attributes from source data (such as fields of features in a feature table or attributes of graphics in a graphics overlay) to display unique multilayer symbols based on those attributes. This is achieved through an associated SymbolDictionary.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Symbology.SymbolStyle.GetSymbolAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Asynchronously returns a symbol based on the provided list of keys.
member.remarks: This function is useful for obtaining a single, multi-layer symbol from supplied keys. This is commonly used to create symbols and graphics on-the-fly. For example, assume XYZ stylx file has a symbol with key "abc" which is the central symbol and another symbol with key "pqr", which could be the modifier/echelon placed at some offset from central geometry. So if you provide these two keys as attributes then symbol style will find and assemble a symbol accordingly. Once you have that symbol, you can apply it to a Graphic or Renderer, obtain its swatch image, or serialize to JSON. If the Symbol style is not loaded then starting this task will start the load cycle.
member.param: the list of keys required to obtain symbol from the .stylx file.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous save as operation. The value of the task result is a object.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Symbology.RendererNormalizationType
member.summary: Defines the statistical normalization technique used to adjust values measured on different scales to a notionally common scale, often prior to averaging. This enumeration is used by the ClassBreaksRenderer.NormalizationType Property.

remarks.para: Normalizing is the process of dividing one numeric attribute value by another to minimize differences in values based on the size of areas or the number of features in each area. For example, normalizing (dividing) total population by total area yields population per unit area, or density.

member.summary: Base class for Marker symbols used for displaying points

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Symbology.MarkerSymbol.Angle
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle.
member.remarks: Rotates the symbol either relative to the map or the screen, depending on the .

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Symbology.MarkerSymbol.AngleAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle alignment. Default value is

remarks.para: Determines the behavior of the symbol if the map rotates, i.e. whether the symbol should rotate with the map or not.

When the GraphicsRenderingMode is set to the MarkerSymbols (including the inherited: PictureMarkerSymbols, SimpleMarkerSymbols, and TextSymbols) are always aligned with the MapView. This means that if the MapView rotates any MarkerSymbols on the Map will stay in the same rotation as the MapView. Hence the MarkerSymbols will appear to be static in their positioning with respect to the Map. Even though you may set the various MarkerSymbol AngleAlignment Properties, they will not be respected when the GraphicsRenderingMode is set to Static.

Conversely, when the GraphicsLayer.RenderingMode is set to the MarkerSymbols (including inherited Types) will rotate independently of the MapView if the rotation is changed. Furthermore, setting the various MarkerSymbols AngleAlignment Properties is respected by the GraphicsRenderingMode when set to Dynamic.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingFeatures
member.summary: A features (or records) input or output parameter.
member.remarks: Corresponds to GPRecordSet and GPFeatureRecordSetLayer parameter types on the service. A feature contains a and may contains extra attributes on collection. A record (or a row) doesn't contain and information is stored in attributes on collection. When are returned as an output parameter the returned results are provided as a read-only list of using . These features can be visualized on a map using temporary s on a or using on a . If used geoprocessing service is configured to use a result map server, then was populated and it can be used to visualize the results using the symbology predefined by the service. When providing as an input to the geoprocessing task, features can be provided directly from the that was returned from the . If there is a need to create a new set of features or records, can be used.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingFeatures.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the input url that will be sent to the geoprocessing service to get features.
member.remarks: The url is for input parameters only. For output parameters this is empty. For input it must be a url that is accessible to the geoprocessing service so it can get the feature set. If this property is set, it will override the property.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingFeatures.CanGetOutputFeatures
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether features can be returned from the service of an output parameter.
member.remarks: This property applies to output parameters. It indicates the parameter is an output parameter that can get features from the geoprocessing service. Depending on the type of the service the property may already be available. If features are not present then this property indicates that you can use to request features and asynchronously update the property.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingFeatures.Features
member.summary: Gets or sets the features that are sent to or returned from the geoprocessing service.
member.remarks: For an input parameter, this contains features to be sent to the geoprocessing service. This property will be ignored if property is set. For an output parameter, this can contain features returned from a geoprocessing service depending on the service configuration. It can be null for services that have a map service, in which case calling will get the features from the service or can be used to visualize the results without loading them to the client.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingFeatures.GetOutputFeaturesAsync
member.summary: Starts a request to get output features from the service.
member.remarks: If the parameter is an output of a geoprocessing service this can be used to get features if property is NULL. It is not necessary to call this if is already populated.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous get output features operation. The value of the task result contains an object.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingResult
member.summary: contains output parameters returned from the service.
member.remarks: Single output parameters can be found from dictionary where the key of the item is the name of the output parameters and the value is the returned . If used geoprocessing service is configured to use result map server then might be populated. is a dynamic map service that accompanies a geoprocessing service to visualize the geoprocessing results. Each geodataset output parameter of a geoprocessing task will be added as a layer to a map service. The visualization of the layer is determined by the symbology on geoprocessing service. are mainly used to visualize or but in some cases is used as a reference to a geodataset which is added to the result map service as a layer.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingLinearUnit
member.summary: A linear unit input or output parameter.
member.remarks: Corresponds to GPLinearUnit parameter type on the service. Geoprocessing tasks support a set of linear units defined in the enumeration. When a parameter is created with one of the supported the value is sent to the service using defined linear unit type. When a parameter is created with a , the value is converted to meters if the type is not supported. For example if provided is international miles, the value is converted to meters since only the US Survey Miles unit is supported in geoprocessing. After is created, the used linear unit type can be checked from . When is created with a supported , then no conversion takes place and the value is sent to the service using the defined type. When is returned as a output parameter, you can get using method.

member.summary: GeoprocessingParameter is a base class for all concrete parameters types that can be used in geoprocessing.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingParameters
member.summary: GeoprocessingParameters contains input parameters that are sent to the target geoprocessing task.
member.remarks: GeoprocessingParameters contains both input parameters and environment variables that are used in the target geoprocessing task. At a minimum all parameters that are set as required on the published task must to be provided to run the task successfully. Parameters that have default values can be overridden by providing a new value in the inputs dictionary. Optional parameters can be provided the same way. also contains environment variables for the geoprocessing task such as and .

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingParameters.#ctor(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingExecutionType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A indicating the tasks execution type.
member.remarks: When are created is used to define how the targeted geoprocessing task is being run on the service. If the geoprocessing service is set to use synchronous Execute endpoint then needs to be used. If the geoprocessing service is set use asynchronous Submit endpoint then needs to be used. The execution type defines how the geoprocessing task is run on the service and in both cases ArcGIS Runtime uses asynchronous model to communicate with the service.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingParameters.ExecutionType
member.summary: Gets the execution type set on this geoprocessing parameters object.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geoprocessing.GeoprocessingTask
member.summary: GeoprocessingTask is used to run geoprocessing task that is published as a web service.
member.remarks: GeoprocessingTask is the main component when running geoprocessing tasks. The task might be published through ArcGIS Server or Local server (on the platforms that supports it) using either synchronous execute or asynchronous submit execution type. When is created it is important to match to the value on the service. 1. Create using full URL to the target geoprocessing task endpoint. 2. Create providing corresponding 3. Create needed s and add them to where key is the name of the parameter and value is created parameter. 4. Set environmental variables on if needed. 5. Create with . 6. Start listening for status and message changes using event. 7. Run targeted geoprocessing tool using which returns when finished. 8. Handle returned values accordingly. Access output parameters through dictionary where key is the name of the output parameter and the value is returned parameter. If used geoprocessing service is configured to use result map service might be created for you.

member.summary: Converts a job into a JSON representation.
member.remarks: Converts a job into a JSON representation. Will return NULL if an error occurs.
member.returns: A JSON string-representation of a job.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Job`1.CheckStatusAsync
member.summary: Initiates a request to check the server status.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous checking of job status. The value of the task result is a bool indicating if the check was successful. The task completes after the status has been checked. If the job is polling the server for status and is in a time gap, then calling this method will ensure a request is sent right away. The result can be false if the job is not checking server status for example if the job status is paused or uploading.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.CostAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute used to measure and model impedance on the network, such as travel time (transit time on a street).

remarks.para: Network analysis often involves the minimization of a cost (also known as impedance) during the calculation of a path (also known as finding the best route). Common examples include finding the fastest route (minimizing travel time) or the shortest route (minimizing distance).
Cost attributes are a property of the underlying network dataset.

These attributes are apportionable along an edge; that is, they are divided proportionately along the length of an edge. For example, if travel time is modeled as a cost attribute, traversing half an edge will take half the time as does traversing the whole edge: if the travel time to traverse the edge is 3 minutes, it takes 1.5 minutes to traverse half the edge.

member.summary: Creates a localized resources object.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.LocalizedResources.TryGetSupportedLanguage(System.String)
member.summary: Return "language" if supported. If not - uses fallback logic to get appropriate language; if nothing found again, returns null. The language is searched by CLR (parameter tryParent must be true). Each language should contain string "Resources_Language", because there is no way to determine returned ResourceSet (parent language can be returned).

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.LocalizedResources.RuntimeCoreNet#GeneratedWrappers#ICoreCallback_LocalizedResources_GetCurrentDecimalSeparator#GetCurrentDecimalSeparator(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLocalizedResource)
member.summary: Get current decimal separator callback.
member.remarks: The callback should return a decimal separator string according to current locale settings. This is used by driving directions engine and navigation component to format distance strings.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.LocalizedResources.RuntimeCoreNet#GeneratedWrappers#ICoreCallback_LocalizedResources_GetCurrentLanguage#GetCurrentLanguage(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLocalizedResource)
member.summary: Get current language callback.
member.remarks: The callback should return a string using language identifier retrieved from corresponding list of supported language identifiers.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.LocalizedResources.RuntimeCoreNet#GeneratedWrappers#ICoreCallback_LocalizedResources_GetSupportedLanguages#GetSupportedLanguages(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLocalizedResource)
member.summary: Get supported languages callback.
member.remarks: The callback should return at least one language id in form "ll-CC" where "ll" is a language identifier and "CC" is a country identifier.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.PointBarrier
member.summary: A point barrier object used to restrcit route solving.
member.remarks: A class that represents a point location to be avoided (or penalized) by a route. PointBarrier may represent a restricted location to be avoided by a route (e.g., a car accident) or a location at which some additional delay occurs if visited along a route (e.g., a railroad crossing).

member.summary: Gets or sets the point barrier's type.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.PointBarrier.GetAddedCost(System.String)
member.summary: Gets added cost.
member.remarks: Get the amount of additional cost that has been added for a particular attribute on this barrier. If no cost has been added, or an incorrect name is specified, a value of zero will be returned.
member.returns: A value of the additional cost.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.PointBarrier.SetAddedCost(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets added cost.
member.remarks: Set the amount of additional cost for an attribute by name. Any additional cost, e.g. Minutes, TravelTime, Kilometers, can be modified with this method.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.PolygonBarrier
member.summary: A polygon barrier object is used to restrict route solving.
member.remarks: A class that represents a polygon feature to be avoided (or penalized) by a route. Polygon_barrier may represent a regional area of interest within the network to be avoided (i.e., not entered) by a route (e.g., a flood zone) or to penalize/delay a route within any portions of the area traversed by the route (e.g., a busy downtown area or a bad neighborhood).

member.summary: Creates a polygon barrier instance.

member.summary: Gets the polygon barrier's geometry.

member.summary: Gets or sets the polygon barrier's type.

member.summary: Gets scale factor for cost.
member.returns: A value for the scale factor.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.PolygonBarrier.SetScaleFactorForCost(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets scale factor for cost.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.PolylineBarrier
member.summary: A polyline barrier is used to restrict route solving.
member.remarks: A class that represents a linear feature to be avoided (or penalized) by a route. Polyline_barrier may represent a linear feature (e.g., a subpath in the network) to be avoided (i.e., not crossed or followed) by a route or to penalize/delay a route along any portions of the feature traversed by the route (e.g., a stretch of interstate with temporarily reduced speed limits due to local construction along an adjacent lane).

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.RouteShapeType
member.summary: Indicates the route shape type. This parameter is applicable only if is set to true.

remarks.para: No matter which value you choose for the RouteShapeType parameter, the best route is always determined by minimizing the travel time or the travel distance, never using the Euclidean distance (or as the crow flies distance) between the stops. This means that only the returned route shapes are different, not the underlying streets that are searched when finding the route.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.RouteShapeType.None
member.summary: Do not return any shapes for the routes. This value can be useful in cases where you are only interested in determining the total travel time or travel distance of the route. For example, if your application has already calculated the route and after some time your application needs to only calculate the expected time of arrival (ETA) to the destination, you can set the parameter to true and the RouteShapeType parameter to None.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.RouteShapeType.StraightLine
member.summary: Return a straight line between the stops.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.RouteShapeType.TrueShapeWithMeasures
member.summary: Return the exact shape of the resulting route that is based on the underlying streets and include route measurements that keep track of the cumulative travel time or travel distance along the route relative to the first stop. When this value is chosen for the RouteShapeType parameter, each point that makes up the route shape will include an M value along with X and Y values. The M value, also known as a measure value, indicates the accumulated travel time or travel distance at that point along the route. The M values can be used to determine how far you have traveled from the start of the route or the remaining distance or time left to reach the destination. The M values store travel time if the is set to TravelTime and store the travel distance if the is set to Kilometers or Miles.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.TravelMode.UseHierarchy
member.summary: Gets or sets the solver hierarchy setting.
member.remarks: A hierarchical solve tends to prefer higher-order streets such a freeways.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.UTurnPolicy
member.summary: Indicates the u-turn policy. Use this to restrict or permit the route from making U-turns at junctions.
member.remarks: In order to understand the parameter values, keep in mind that a junction is a point where only two streets intersect each other. If three or more streets intersect at a point, it is called as an intersection. The end of a culs-de-sac is deemed to be a dead-end.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.UTurnPolicy.NotAllowed
member.summary: U-turns are prohibited at all junctions, intersections and dead-ends. Note that even when this parameter value is chosen, the route can still make U-turns at stops. If you wish to prohibit U-turns even at the stops, you can set the appropriate value for the CurbApproach attribute of the stops.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.UTurnPolicy.AllowedAtDeadEnds
member.summary: U-turns are prohibited at all junctions and intersections and are permitted only at dead ends.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.UTurnPolicy.AllowedAtIntersections
member.summary: Allow backtracking at intersections.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalysis.UTurnPolicy.AllowedAtDeadEndsAndIntersections
member.summary: Allow backtracking ad dead ends and intersections.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GeodatabaseSyncTask.RegisterGeodatabaseAsync(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Data.Geodatabase)
member.summary: Registers a copy of a sync enabled geodatabase with a service so the copy can sync to the service.
member.remarks: The local geodatabase file is typically a copy of another original geodatabase file. The original geodatabase must already be known to the service and have a replica ID. A successful register will give the local geodatabase it's own replica ID and separate it from the original. It can then be synchronized with the service to receive updates. After taking copies of the original database, do not sync changes to the original until all copies have been registered. This operation is not related to which removes the geodatabase from the service.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous register operation.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geocoding.LocatorTask
member.summary: Represents a task that enables geocoding and reverse-geocoding against an ArcGIS locator.
member.remarks: Geocoding is the process of assigning a location, usually in the form of coordinate values (points), to an address by comparing the descriptive location elements in the address to those present in the reference material. Addresses come in many forms, ranging from the common address format of a house number followed by the street name and succeeding information to other location descriptions such as postal zone or census tract. An address includes any type of information that distinguishes a place. Reverse geocoding is the process of determining the closest address to a location usually given in the form of a coordinate value (point).

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geocoding.LocatorTask.SuggestAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Suggest possible variants of a given address.
member.remarks: Geocoding suggestions provide a mechanism for allowing character-by-character auto-complete. By passing in text entry and an optional location, results can be quickly found for client display purposes. Suggestions are not limited to addresses, they can also be used for POIs (Points of Interest).
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous suggest operation. The value of the task result contains a read-only collection of objects.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geocoding.SuggestParameters.CountryCode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value representing the country. Providing this value increases geocoding speed. Acceptable values include the full country name, the ISO 3166-1 2-digit country code, or the ISO 3166-1 3-digit country code. A list of supported countries and codes is available here.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geocoding.SuggestParameters.MaxResults
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of returned suggestions.
member.remarks: Supported values from interval [1..15], 5 by default.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geocoding.SuggestParameters.PreferredSearchLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets preferred search location.
member.remarks: Distance specifying with location the preferred area where candidates will be searched. Supported values are from interval [1000..50000], 50000 by default.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Geocoding.SuggestParameters.SearchArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the geographic area for which searching for locations will be limited to.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.ILoadable
member.summary: A interface for loading meta-data for an object.

remarks.p: Remark: A resource that is capable of loading its meta-data asynchronously is referred to as a loadable. It could represent a remote service, or a dataset on disk.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.ILoadable.LoadError
member.summary: Retrieve the load error as an Exception.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.ILoadable.LoadStatus
member.summary: Retrieve the load status.

member.name: E:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.ILoadable.Loaded
member.summary: Occurs when the object is done loading.

member.name: E:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.ILoadable.LoadStatusChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the loadable load status changed.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.ILoadable.CancelLoad
member.summary: Cancel loading meta-data for the object.

remarks.p: Remark: Will cancel loading the meta-data if the object is loading. Will always call the done loading if this is called.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.ILoadable.LoadAsync
member.summary: Load the meta-data for the object asynchronously.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous load operation.

remarks.p: Remark: Will load the meta-data if the object is not loaded. Will always call the done loading if this is called.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.ILoadable.RetryLoadAsync
member.summary: Load or retry loading meta-data for the object asynchronously.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous load operation.

remarks.p: Remark: Will retry loading the meta-data if the object is failed to load. Will load the object if the object is not loaded. Will not retry to load the object if the object is loaded. Will always call the done loading if this is called.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreAngularUnitId

member.remarks: These values can be used to create instances of RT_AreaUnitHandle, as an alternative to using well-known IDs (WKIDs). In addition to the units in this enumeration, you can also use less commonly-used units, by passing a WKID of an angular unit to the inherited RT_Unit_fromUnitId factory method. The function RT_Unit_getUnitId returns the WKID of the unit. Date: 2016-10-03 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Indicates that the unit of angular measurement is a custom unit, or is a unit not listed in the enumerated type. member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISMapImageLayer.#ctor
member.summary: *Internal Use* Creates a map image layer object.
member.remarks: Use this object to create a map image layer. Once the layer is created you will have to set the URI by using RT_ArcGISMapImageLayer_setURI. Note: Prefer using RT_ArcGISMapImageLayer_createWithURI for creating a layer with an associated URI. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_Layer_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_Layer_destroy on the return value.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment
member.summary: Defines an ArcGIS Runtime Environment handle.
member.remarks: Contains functions that are global and affect the entire runtime environment. Also contains licensing functions to set up deployment licensing for an application. Note that APIs should call at least one of the methods as early as possible during the code execution to ensure the correct initialization of pplx and the handling of file paths containing UTF8 characters on Windows. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.EnableBreakOnException(System.Boolean)
member.summary: *Internal Use* Enables/disables breaking on exceptions.
member.remarks: Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0
member.param: true if the runtime should break on an exception, false otherwise.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.EnableLeakDetection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: *Internal Use* Enables/disables memory leak detection.
member.remarks: Disabling will cause the runtime to dump all of the handle instances that were currently being tracked and it will not track handle instances from the point of disabling. Enabling leak detection will make the the runtime track all handle instances allocated from the point of enabling. By default, leak detection is turned on in debug builds and off in release builds. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0
member.param: true if the runtime should be tracking handle allocations and deallocations, false otherwise.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.EnableShowAssertDialog(System.Boolean)
member.summary: *Internal Use* Enables/disables the assert/abort dialog on Windows Desktop.
member.remarks: Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0
member.param: true the assert/abort dialog should appear with abort, break and continue options. enable false if all asserts and errors should go to the debug console.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.GetInstallDirectory
member.summary: *Internal Use* Get the location of the root folder for the deployment. This is also the pedata location.
member.remarks: This is used for the default location to look for resources and the pedata location. Possible resources are the DirectX shaders, mil2525c dictionary symbol style, app6b dictionary symbol style, and the hydrographic layers dictionary symbol style. DirectX shaders default location. install_path /resources/shaders mil2525c dictionary symbol style default location. install_path /resources/symbols/mil2525c app6b dictionary symbol style default location. install_path /resources/symbols/app6b hydrographic layers dictionary symbol style default location. install_path /resources/symbols/hydrographic_s57 Date: 2016-10-04 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.GetLicense
member.summary: Get the license details about the application.
member.remarks: The license details includes the RT_LicenseStatus, RT_LicenseLevel, and RT_LicenseType values for the licensed application. It also contains the expiry date of the license or whether the provided license is perpetual. Date: 2016-08-16 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.GetScreenCoordinateType
member.summary: *Internal Use* Get the type of screen coordinates.
member.remarks: Screen coordinates may be in DIPs or pixels (depending on the platform). The default is RT_ScreenCoordinateType_DIPs. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.SetBetaWatermark(System.Boolean)
member.summary: *Internal Use* This will override the license watermark text with the beta text info.
member.remarks: This will override the license watermark text with the beta text info. true the water mark will always appear even if you set a license false (default) the water mark will not appear. The developer license will appear if a license is not set. Date: 2016-08-16 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: Set to true if you wish the beta watermark to appear, false if you wish the license level text to appear.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.SetGraphicsAPI(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGraphicAPIType)
member.summary: *Internal Use* Set the graphics API to be used.
member.remarks: This is used to set the graphics API for the lifetime of the application. It cannot be changed once set. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The graphics API to be used.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.SetInstallDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: *Internal Use* Set the location of the root folder for the deployment. Also sets the pedata location.
member.remarks: This is used to set the default location to look for resources and will set the pedata location. Possible resources are the DirectX shaders, mil2525c dictionary symbol style, app6b dictionary symbol style, and the hydrographic layers dictionary symbol style. DirectX shaders default location. install_path /resources/shaders mil2525c dictionary symbol style default location. install_path /resources/symbols/mil2525c app6b dictionary symbol style default location. install_path /resources/symbols/app6b hydrographic layers dictionary symbol style default location. install_path /resources/symbols/hydrographic_s57 Date: 2016-10-04 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The path to the root folder of the deployment.

member.summary: License an application for deployment using an ESRI license key.
member.remarks: License an application for deployment using an ESRI license key. Date: 2016-08-16 Non-overloaded method: SetLicense Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The lite, basic, standard, or advanced ESRI license key.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISRuntimeEnvironment.SetLicense(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLicenseInfo)
member.summary: License an application for deployment using license info.
member.remarks: License an application for deployment using a license info for named-user access. A license info instance can be obtained from a portal for the current logged in user. The license info instance is only valid for 30 days so the user will be required to log into the portal again when this expires. Date: 2016-08-16 Non-overloaded method: SetLicenseInfo Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The RT_LicenseInfoHandle used for named-user access.
