member.summary: License an application for deployment using an ESRI license key and extension license keys.
member.remarks: License an application for deployment using an ESRI license key and one or more extension license keys. Date: 2016-08-16 Non-overloaded method: SetLicenseWithExtensions Since: 100.0.0
member.param: A vector of extension license keys.
The lite, basic, standard, or advanced ESRI license key.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArcGISTiledLayer
member.summary: An instance of this class allows you to display data from a ArcGIS Map service by using pre-generated tiles.
member.remarks: The service may be hosted in the cloud on ArcGIS Online or on-premise with ArcGIS Server. An ArcGIS tiled layer uses a cache of pre-generated tiles to create a map instead of dynamically generating map images. Same as a RT_LayerHandle. Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. You need to pass this handle to all ArcGIS tiled layer functions. The ArcGIS tiled layer class is derived from the layer class. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Layer_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreAreaUnitId
member.summary: Defines a list of the most commonly-used units of area measurement. These values can be used to create instances of RT_AreaUnitHandle, as an alternative to using well-known IDs (WKIDs). In addition to the units in this enumeration, you can also use less commonly-used units, by passing a WKID of an area unit to the inherited RT_Unit_fromUnitId factory method. The function RT_Unit_getUnitId returns the WKID of the unit.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreAreaUnitId.Other
member.summary: Indicates that the unit of area measurement is a custom unit, or a unit not listed in the enumerated type. This value may be returned from an AreaUnit created from a WKID of a less commonly used unit of measurement that does not have an equivalent value in this enumeration.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreArray
member.summary: Defines a immutable dynamic array.
member.remarks: You need to pass this handle to all array functions. You will get this handle from various functions and the handle must be destroyed from RT_Array_destroy. The array holds RT_ElementHandle objects. Use RT_Array_getValueType to determine what type of RT_ElementHandle objects are being stored in the array. A RT_ElementHandle that has been retrieved from the array can be converted to its underlying type by calling (for example) int32_t int_value = RT_Element_getValueAsInt32(element_handle, error_handler); Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

RT_ErrorType_commonInvalidArgument grid line width must be greater than 0.0. Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_BackgroundGrid_destroy on the return value.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreBasemap
member.summary: The basemap contains layers which are base or reference layers.
member.remarks: Typically, you will use one basemap layer that is drawn beneath all other layers, but you can also add a basemap layer on top of all other layers to depict boundaries, labels, or a road network. You need to pass this handle to all basemap functions. It represents an instance of a basemap. You cannot directly access basemap properties. You can get this handle from RT_Basemap_create and the handle must be destroyed from RT_Basemap_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreBingMapLayer
member.summary: An instance of this class allows you to display Bing map layers.
member.remarks: Information about Portal having a Bing map KeyA Bing map layer displays map content from a Bing Maps Imagery web service. The service provides access to static map tiles and imagery meta-data. The Bing map layer requires a Bing map key to be set. There are 2 ways to get a Bing map key. From a portal which contains the Bing map key. From a developer setting the Bing map key into the layer. If the layer does not have a Bing map key or a portal URL where it can get the Bing map key when load is called the layer will fail to load. The developer must set the Bing map key or portal URL and call retry load so the layer can get the Bing map key. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreClosestFacilityTask
member.summary: A class that implements the closest facility task.
member.remarks: The closest facility task class uses a transportation network to measure the cost of traveling between incidents and facilities and determines which are nearest to one other. When finding closest facilities, you can specify how many to find and whether the direction of travel is toward or away from them. You need to pass this handle to all closest facility task functions. It must be destroyed by calling RT_ClosestFacilityTask_destroy. Date: 2016-08-24 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDictionary
member.summary: Defines a dictionary object.
member.remarks: The RT_ElementHandle object can be reused for multiple calls while adding/inserting/updating values within the collection. So you can instantiate one RT_ElementHandle and iteratively change it's value and call add/update/insert on the collection to modify the values of the collection. If the overhead of creating these RT_ElementHandle does become too much for a specific value type, then consider subclassing the collection type and provide "overloaded" methods that would accept that value type directly. This would eliminate the overhead of instantiating these RT_ElementHandle objects.You need to pass this handle to all dictionary functions. You will get this handle from various functions and the handle must be destroyed from RT_Dictionary_destroy. There are a couple of performance optimizations to consider with the generic collection type: Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDictionaryRenderer
member.summary: A Dictionary Renderer object.
member.remarks:
The DictionarySymbolStyle is created using a given specification such as "mil2525d". Each specification depends on attribute names that define the symbology and text of each feature. For example, the mil2525d specification looks for attributes named "identity", "symbolset", "symbolentity", and "modifier1", among many others. These attributes reference different symbols in the style file that are assembled to create a unique symbol. In order to display features using the DictionaryRenderer, you must make sure the DictionaryRenderer and associated DictionarySymbolStyle know which attributes in your data to use. This can be achieved in multiple ways:
Pre-author your data so that the attribute names match the attributes needed by the specification. In the case of the mil2525d specification, author a feature service (or other data source) with a field named "identity", another named "symbolset", and so on. In this scenario, you create a FeatureTable from the source data, create a FeatureLayer from the FeatureTable, apply the DictionaryRenderer to the FeatureLayer, and the symbols are generated automatically and applied to the layer in the map. The same workflow applies for Graphics in a GraphicsOverlay. Ideally when creating graphics on the fly, you can give the attributes names that match the specification. When fields in the FeatureTable and attributes in Graphics have expected names, the DictionaryRenderer automatically finds them. Manually map your attribute names to those expected by the specification. You can map as many attribute names as necessary for the specification, but only need to map attribute names that do not match the specification (all matching attribute names will be automatically matched by the renderer). For example, an expected attribute "symbolset" might appear as the "symbol_set" field in your FeatureTable. In this scenario, you can create a ServiceFeatureTable from a feature service, create a FeatureLayer from that feature table, create a DictionaryRenderer by manually mapping the "symbol_set" name to the "symbolset" name expected by the specification, and finally apply the renderer to the FeatureLayer.
A DictionaryRenderer can be applied to pre-authored data, such as feature services, mobile geodatabases (generated from ArcMap or a sync-enabled feature service), and feature layers in a mobile map package. You can also apply it to a GraphicsOverlay, which allow for on-the-fly graphic generation.You need to pass this handle to all dictionary renderer functions. This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Renderer_destroy. The DictionaryRenderer uses attributes from source data (such as fields of features in a feature table or attributes of graphics in a graphics overlay) to display unique multilayer symbols based on those attributes. This is achieved through an associated DictionarySymbolStyle. Date: 2016-10-04 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDictionarySymbolStyle
member.summary: A dictionary symbol style object.
member.remarks:
A DictionarySymbolStyle can be used in conjunction with a DictionaryRenderer applied to a FeatureLayer or GraphicsOverlay.
When used by itself, the DictionarySymbolStyle supports two key workflows. The first is to find a symbol with provided attributes values. This is done by creating a map of field names and attribute values (as determined by the associated specification), and passing those into getSymbol, which returns a new Symbol. In this case, the key is the name of the specification field (e.g. "symbolset" in the case of mil2525d), and the value is value you want associated with that field (e.g "Atmospheric"). You might use this symbol to create a new Graphic.
You can also use a standalone DictionarySymbolStyle to search for symbol primitives. Symbol primitives are the individual symbols that make up more complex and advanced multilayer military symbols. This is achieved using searchSymbols. You could create a symbol picker app that searches for all symbols that have the tag "maritime" in it. The search results contain symbols which you could then either use as they are or extract from them different individual symbols to create a new composite symbol.You need to pass this handle to all dictionary symbol style functions. This object talks to rule engines to generate symbols and search symbols specific to the standard. It must be destroyed by calling RT_SymbolStyle_destroy. A DictionarySymbolStyle is made up of a *.stylx file (a sqlite database from ArcGIS Pro), which contains the symbol primitives for a given symbology specification (such as mil2525d), as well as a rule engine that parses input fields. The DictionarySymbolStyle assembles new symbols from the input attributes, and can also apply geometry manipulations to the symbols in the case of multipoint geometries. Date: 2016-10-04 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDictionarySymbolStyle.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new dictionay symbol style object.
member.remarks: Use this method to create an object. An example of specificationType is "mil2525d". Use the getSpecificationTypes function to get a string list of all the supported specifications. Since a DictionarySymbolStyle requires a *.stylx file and no stylx location is set, it is assumed that the *.stylx file is in the default location. For example, mil2525d stylx file's default path is sdk_install_path/resources/symbols/mil2525d.stylx, where sdk_install_path is the path returned from the ArcGIS Runtime environment install directory. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_SymbolStyle_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. This object talks to rule engines to generate symbols and search symbols specific to the standard. Date: 2016-10-04 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_SymbolStyle_destroy on the return value.
member.param: name of the dictionary(stylx) to be created.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDictionarySymbolStyle.GetSymbolAsync(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDictionary)
member.summary: Asynchronously returns a symbol based on the provided attributes.
member.remarks: This function is useful for obtaining a single, multi-layer symbol from supplied attributes. This is commonly used to create symbols and graphics on-the-fly. For example, with mil2525d, you may want to obtain a symbol where "symbolset" is 40, "modifier1" is "Incident Qualifier : Accident", "echelon" is "Army", and so on. All of these key/value pairs can be used to obtain the specific symbol that you need. Once you have that symbol, you can apply it to a Graphic or Renderer, obtain its swatch image, or serialize to JSON. If the DictionarySymbolStyle is not loaded then starting this task will start the load cycle. Date: 2016-10-04 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: RT_DictionaryHandle of RT_ElementType_string type key and RT_ElementType_variant value. It is a key value pair for the attributes required to obtain symbol from the rule engine associated to Dictionary symbol style.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol
member.summary: Defines a set of symbols and their visible distance range.
member.remarks: Distance composite scene symbol contain symbols with distance ranges. Based on distance from the camera the symbols are rendered or not. Note that the ranges for each symbol are independent and may overlap It must be destroyed by calling RT_Symbol_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Do not call this method from hand-written code. (may be necessary in hand-written interop code).
member.remarks: If you have to create wrappers around IntPtrs (eg when using generated wrappers from hand-written wrapper code), always use the PrivateCreateFromHandle factory method, to ensure that the correct derived class is instantiated.

member.summary: Do not call this method from hand-written code. (may be necessary in hand-written interop code).
member.remarks: Creates a CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol class wrapping and owning the native handle. NB: Must not be passed a native handle that is taken from an existing CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol instance.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol.PrivateCreateFromHandleInternal_CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Do not call this method from hand-written code. (may be necessary in hand-written interop code).
member.remarks: Creates a CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol class wrapping and owning the native handle. NB: Must not be passed a native handle that is taken from an existing CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol instance.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol.#ctor
member.summary: Create a distance composite scene symbol object.
member.remarks: Use this method to create an distance composite scene symbol which is a container of Symbols with distance display ranges. Each symbol add to the contained range collection can specify a minimum and maximum display distance. when a feature is render the distance from the camera will be check against the specified minimum and maximum range to determin the symbols visibility. Note that symbol ranges for the contained symbols are not exclusing so may overlap. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_Symbol_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_Symbol_destroy on the return value.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceCompositeSceneSymbol.Ranges
member.summary: Return the symbols distance ranges.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceSymbolRange
member.summary: Used contain multiple symbols with distance ranges.
member.remarks: Distance composite symbol displays graphics with multiple symbols that may have distance ranges. The range contains a minumim and maximum distance for rendering the symbol. Outside of that range the symbol is not visible. It must be destroyed by calling RT_DistanceSymbolRange_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceSymbolRange.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Constructor to takes ownership of the handle, called from PrivateCreateFromHandle

member.summary: Called by base class when native object is to be released

member.summary: Releases any callbacks in this class or any derived classes. This is only called by Dispose, not the Finalizer

member.summary: Do not call this method from hand-written code. (may be necessary in hand-written interop code).
member.remarks: Creates a CoreDistanceSymbolRange class wrapping and owning the native handle. NB: Must not be passed a native handle that is taken from an existing CoreDistanceSymbolRange instance.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceSymbolRange.#ctor
member.summary: Create a distance symbol range object.
member.remarks: Creates a Distance symbol range with just no symbol or no range properties. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_DistanceSymbolRange_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_DistanceSymbolRange_destroy on the return value.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceSymbolRange.#ctor(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSymbol)
member.summary: Create a distance symbol range object.
member.remarks: Creates a Distance Range with just a symbol and no range properties. As a result the symbol will always be visible regardless of the distance from the camera. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_DistanceSymbolRange_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_DistanceSymbolRange_destroy on the return value.
member.param: A symbol to set in the distance symbol range.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceSymbolRange.#ctor(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSymbol,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Create a distance symbol range object.
member.remarks: Creates a Distance Range with a symbol and range properties. As a result the symbol will only be visible when the camera is within the specified distance range. Note that setting the maximum range to 0.0 indicates that there isn't a maximum range limit and the symbol will always be visible beyond it's mimimum range. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_DistanceSymbolRange_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_commonInvalidArgument Invalid argument error occurs if the either the minimum or maximum range are less than zero. Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_DistanceSymbolRange_destroy on the return value.
member.param: The maximum distance to set in the distance symbol range. Must be >= 0.0, 0.0 indicates there is no maxumin range.
The minimum distance to set in the distance symbol range. Must be >= 0.0.
A symbol to set in the distance symbol range.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceSymbolRange.MaxDistance
member.summary: Get the maximum distance (in meters) of the distance symbol range.
member.remarks: Get the maximum distance (in meters) of the distance symbol range object. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceSymbolRange.MinDistance
member.summary: Get the minimum distance (in meters) of the distance symbol range.
member.remarks: Get the pitch (in degrees) of the scene marker symbol. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreDistanceSymbolRange.Symbol
member.summary: Get the symbol of the distance symbol range.
member.remarks: Get the symbol RT_SymbolHandle of the distance symbol range object. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource
member.summary: An base class for all elevation sources.
member.remarks: You need to pass this handle to all elevation source functions. The Elevation Source is a base class of implementations of elevation sources. To use and elevation you create an instance of a derived class and set it in to a Surface RT_SurfaceHandle in the Scene RT_SceneHandle. The combination of Elevation sources with in the Surface generate a rendering surface on which data can be draped or offset from. The handle must be destroyed from RT_ElevationSource_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Constructor to takes ownership of the handle, called from PrivateCreateFromHandle

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.PrivateDestroyHandle(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Called by base class when native object is to be released

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.DisposeCallbacks
member.summary: Releases any callbacks in this class or any derived classes. This is only called by Dispose, not the Finalizer

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.PrivateCreateFromHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Do not call this method from hand-written code. (may be necessary in hand-written interop code).
member.remarks: Creates a CoreElevationSource class wrapping and owning the native handle. NB: Must not be passed a native handle that is taken from an existing CoreElevationSource instance.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.PrivateCreateFromHandleInternal_CoreElevationSource(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Do not call this method from hand-written code. (may be necessary in hand-written interop code).
member.remarks: Creates a CoreElevationSource class wrapping and owning the native handle. NB: Must not be passed a native handle that is taken from an existing CoreElevationSource instance.

member.summary: *Internal Use* Get the instance id of the Elevation source referenced by the specified RT_ElevationSourceHandle

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.IsEnabled
member.summary: Get the "is enabled" state of the elevation source.
member.remarks: Get the is enabled state of the elevation source object which indicates if this elevation source participates in the generation of the surface RT_SurfaceHandle. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.LoadError
member.summary: Returns the error for the load if there is one.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.LoadStatus
member.summary: Returns the current load status of the elevation source.

member.summary: Get the name of the elevation source.
member.remarks: Returns name of elevation source. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.ObjectType
member.summary: Get the type of the elevation source.
member.remarks: Get the type of the elevation source object RT_ElevationSourceType Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.SetDoneLoadingCallback(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreCallback_Loadable_DoneLoading)
member.summary: Sets the callback invoked when the elevation source is done loading.
member.param: The function to invoke. Can be NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.SetLoadStatusChangedCallback(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreCallback_Loadable_LoadStatusChanged)
member.summary: Sets the callback invoked when the elevation source's load status has changed.
member.param: The function to invoke. Can be NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.SetRequestRequiredCallback(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreCallback_Request_RequestRequired)
member.summary: Sets the callback to invoke when the elevation source needs to have the client provide additional data.
member.param: The function to invoke. Can be NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.SetStateChangedCallback(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreCallback_NotifyStateChanged_StateChanged)
member.summary: Callback invoked when any state of the elevation source have changed.
member.param: The function to invoke. Can be NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.CancelLoad
member.summary: Cancel loading the elevation source.
member.remarks: Cancels any outstanding requests that the elevation source has sent. If the elevation source is in the RT_LoadStatus_loading state then the RT_LoadStatus and RT_ErrorHandle will be set to RT_LoadStatus_failedToLoad and RT_ErrorType_commonUserCanceled and RT_Loadable_doneLoading_fn will be called. Date: 2016-09-29 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.Load
member.summary: Start the process of getting all the required information.
member.remarks: Loads the elevation source information. Load will only try loading the object if the load status is RT_LoadStatus_notLoaded. If the object is not in the RT_LoadStatus_notLoaded state the object will do nothing and the RT_Loadable_doneLoading_fn function will be called. You must implement RT_Request_requestRequired_fn if the elevation source requires additional information. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSource.RetryLoad
member.summary: Retry loading the elevation source.
member.remarks: Set the load status to not loaded and calls load if the elevation source is in the failed to load state. Does nothing if the elevation source is in any other state. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreElevationSourceType
member.summary: The list of elevation source types.
member.remarks: This is used to determine the elevation source type. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreEnvelope
member.summary: A envelope object which is derived from a geometry object.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreEnvelopeBuilder.ChangeAspectRatio(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Adjust the envelope's aspect ratio to match the ratio of the given width and height
member.remarks: Adjust the envelope's aspect ratio to match the ratio of the given width and height. The operation preserves the center of the envelope and will only increase either height or width, not both. If the new width would be greater than the old, the width will be changed and the height will remain the same. If the new width would be less than or equal to the old, the height will be changed and the width will remain the same. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Callback, called when the request-able objects set request required.
member.remarks: The function pointer is called when data is required. Retrieving the data should happen on a different thread. Once the data is retrieved RT_Request_handleResponse should be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The function to invoke. Can be NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.summary: Cancels loading meta-data for the object.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreExportTileCacheTask.CreateDefaultExportTileCacheParametersAsync(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeometry,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates and returns an RT_TaskHandle of RT_ExportTileCacheParametersHandle.
member.remarks: This function is asynchronous because it makes use of the service metadata to build a RT_ExportTileCacheParametersHandle object. Calling the function will trigger load of the RT_ExportTileCacheTaskHandle, unless it's already loaded. A value of 0 specified for either scale parameter will include all level IDs down to the min/max level ID scale. For example: a minScale of 10000 and a maxScale of 500 will select level IDs between 1:500 and 1:10,000 scale. a minScale of 0 and a maxScale of 500 will select level IDs below 1:500 scale. a minScale of 10000 and a maxScale of 0 will select level IDs above 1:10,000 scale. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: a RT_GeometryHandle specifying the area to be exported.
the map scale '1:maxScale' below which level IDs should be exported
the map scale '1:minScale' above which level IDs should be exported

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreFacility
member.summary: A class that represents a facility.
member.remarks: Facilities represent locations that can serve as the starting point or ending point of a closest facility analysis, for example, a fire station or a hospital. The RT_FacilityHandle class contains one of location inputs for the RT_ClosestFacilityTaskHandle. The RT_ClosestFacilityTaskHandle will create a route between facilities and incidents. You need to pass this handle to all RT_FacilityHandle functions. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Facility_destroy. Date: 2016-08-24 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreFeatureRequestMode.OnInteractionCache
member.summary: The features are requested and populated into the table as and when they are needed based on the user or developer interacting with the layer (map pan, zoom) and the features will be cached.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreFeatureRequestMode.OnInteractionNoCache
member.summary: The features are explicitly requested for the layer work in this mode. It is suitable for always working against the latest data and will therefore have a high network bandwith. Queries always go to the server for all interactions (pans, zooms, selects or queries).

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreFeatureRequestMode.ManualCache
member.summary: Data is requested when the user explicity calls populateFromService. All queries performed on the table will be done locally.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreFileRequest.PersistentRequestId
member.summary: Get the platform-defined ID of the long-running request.
member.remarks: When set, this id may be persisted by the C_API. Then, on subsequent runs of the application C_API may perform the request again, setting this id into the new request instance. Platform code can then use the ID to retrieve the existing background download request from a platform-specific OS service. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Sets the callback that will be invoked to request that the RT_FileRequestHandle be paused.
member.remarks: The callback will be invoked when the runtime wants the platform code to pause a request. If no callback is registered the RT_FileRequestHandle will be canceled. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The function to be invoked. Can be NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGenerateGeodatabaseParameters.AttachmentSyncDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction for attachments to be synchronized.
member.remarks: This parameter is available when the service resource sync capabilities includes supportsAttachmentsSyncDirection. This parameter defines how attachments will be synced and is only applicable if the feature service has attachments. RT_AttachmentSyncDirection_bidirectional - Attachment edits can be both uploaded from the client and downloaded from the service when syncing. RT_AttachmentSyncDirection_upload - Attachment edits can only be uploaded from the client when syncing. This is useful in cases where the data collector does not want to consume space with attachments from the service, but does need to collect new attachments. RT_AttachmentSyncDirection_none - Attachment edits are never synced from either the client or the server. When RT_GenerateGeodatabaseParameters_setReturnAttachments is set to true, you can set RT_GenerateGeodatabaseParameters_setAttachmentSyncDirection to either RT_AttachmentSyncDirection_bidirectional (default) or RT_AttachmentSyncDirection_upload. In this case, create replica includes attachments from the service. When RT_GenerateGeodatabaseParameters_setReturnAttachments is set to false, you can set RT_GenerateGeodatabaseParameters_setAttachmentSyncDirection to either RT_AttachmentSyncDirection_upload or RT_AttachmentSyncDirection_none (default). In this case, the geodatabase does not include attachments from the service. Attachment sync direction is set during the RT_GeodatabaseSyncTask_generateGeodatabase operation and cannot be overridden during RT_GeodatabaseSyncTask_syncGeodatabase . Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGenerateGeodatabaseParameters.Extent
member.summary: The geometry that is used to intersect the features in the service to replicate into the geodatabase.
member.remarks: This is typically an envelope, but other geometry types can be used too. An intersects test will be used to determine which features are replicated. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGenerateGeodatabaseParameters.LayerOptions
member.summary: The list of layers and tables to include in the geodatabase if the sync model is layer.
member.remarks: For a per layer sync model, this must be populated with minimum of one valid layer id. For valid layers and tables see RT_ArcGISFeatureServiceInfo_getLayerInfos and RT_ArcGISFeatureServiceInfo_getTableInfos. Date: 2016-09-27 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGenerateGeodatabaseParameters.OutSpatialReference
member.summary: The spatial reference that is used for the generated geodatabase.
member.remarks: If this is null, the Extent's spatial reference is used. If that is null the feature services spatial reference is then used. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGenerateLayerOption.IncludeRelated
member.summary: Indicates if only related rows are added to the specific RT_GenerateLayerOption_getLayerId in the generated geodatabase.
member.remarks: This property is only applicable if your data has relationship classes. Set this on a table that is related to by other layers or tables to restrict it to just the rows to just those used in relationships. If this is true then other properties are ignored RT_GenerateLayerOption_getWhereClause and RT_GenerateLayerOption_getUseGeometry. Returns false if there's an error. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: The layer or table Id to further filter in the generated geodatabase.
member.remarks: The Ids used here must match Ids used in geodatabase sync task layer ids Only layers that need further refining need to be included. If there's an error the return value is -1. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGenerateLayerOption.UseGeometry
member.summary: Indicates if RT_GenerateGeodatabaseParameters_getExtent is used to filter the features for downloading.
member.remarks: The default is true. Setting this to false, with no where clause, will retrieve all features. This is ignored if RT_GenerateLayerOption_getIncludeRelated is true Returns false if there's an error. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabaseSyncTask.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a geodatabase sync task object using a URL to create a RT_ArcGISFeatureServiceInfoHandle
member.remarks: Use this method to create an object. To ensure the service info can be loaded, you must call RT_GeodatabaseSyncTask_getFeatureServiceInfo and set any callbacks. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_GeodatabaseSyncTask_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_GeodatabaseSyncTask_destroy on the return value.
member.param: A URL to a feature service with sync capabilities.

member.summary: Cancels loading meta-data for the object.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabaseSyncTask.CreateDefaultGenerateGeodatabaseParametersAsync(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeometry)
member.summary: Creates default parameters for a generate geodatabase.
member.remarks: This will populate the parameters with values matching what the service supports. For example if the service does not support RT_SyncModel_layer then RT_SyncModel_geodatabase will be used All layers from the service will be included. The extent will be the services full extent. Attachments are included by default. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The extent of the data to be included in the generated geodatabase.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabaseSyncTask.CreateDefaultSyncGeodatabaseParametersAsync(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabase)
member.summary: Creates default parameters for a sync geodatabase.
member.remarks: This will populate the parameters with values matching what the sync task's feature service and the geodatabase supports. For a geodatabase with RT_SyncModel_layer then all geodatabase layers will be included. If the service is read-only then the sync direction will be RT_SyncDirection_download. Otherwise the sync direction will be RT_SyncDirection_bidirectional. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabaseSyncTask.GenerateGeodatabase(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGenerateGeodatabaseParameters,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a job that when started will generate a geodatabase from a service.
member.param: a path including a new filename where the downloaded geodatabase is written to.

member.summary: Imports a geodatabase delta and applies it to the given geodatabase.
member.remarks: The task returned by this method returns an array of RT_SyncLayerResultHandle. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The geodatabase to apply a delta to
The path and filename to import the delta from

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabaseSyncTask.Load
member.summary: Loads the meta-data for the object asynchronously.
member.remarks: Will load the meta-data if the object is not loaded. Will always call the done loading if this is called. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabaseSyncTask.RegisterSyncEnabledGeodatabaseAsync(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabase)
member.summary: Registers a copy of a sync enabled geodatabase with a service so the copy can sync to the service.
member.remarks: The local geodatabase file is typically a copy of another original geodatabase file. The original geodatabase must already be known to the service and have a replica ID. A successful register will give the local geodatabase it's own replica ID and separate it from the original. It can then be synchronized with the service to receive updates. After taking copies of the original database, do not sync changes to the original until all copies have been registered. This operation is not related to RT_GeodatabaseSyncTask_unregisterGeodatabaseAsync which removes the geodatabase form the service. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabaseSyncTask.RetryLoad
member.summary: Loads or retry loading meta-data for the object asynchronously.
member.remarks: Will retry loading the meta-data if the object is failed to load. Will load the object if the object is not loaded. Will not retry to load the object if the object is loaded. Will always call the done loading if this is called. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabaseSyncTask.SyncGeodatabase(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSyncGeodatabaseParameters,RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabase)
member.summary: Returns a job to synchronize a geodatabase back to a service.
member.param: Parameters to use to sync the geodatabase

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabaseSyncTask.UnregisterGeodatabaseAsync(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeodatabase)
member.summary: Unregisters a geodatabase from a service removing the services replica id.
member.remarks: After unregistering a geodatabase it can no longer be synced back to the service. This operation is not related to RT_GeodatabaseSyncTask_registerSyncEnabledGeodatabaseAsync which is for registering copies of a geodatabase. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeometryEngine.Cut(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeometry,RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CorePolyline)
member.summary: Cut the 'geometry' RT_GeometryHandle with the 'cutter' RT_PolylineHandle A touch event is considered to be a cut (applies when cutting an RT_PolylineHandle). When cutting an RT_PolylineHandle, all left cuts will be grouped together in the first RT_GeometryHandle, right cuts and coincident cuts are grouped in the second RT_GeometryHandle, and each undefined cut, along with any uncut parts, are output as separate Polylines. When cutting an RT_PolygonHandle, all left cuts are grouped in the first RT_GeometryHandle, all right cuts are in the second RT_GeometryHandle, and each undefined cut, along with any left-over parts after cutting, are output as a separate RT_GeometryHandle. If there were no cuts the an empty RT_ArrayHandle will be returned. If the left or right cut does not exist, the returned RT_GeometryHandle will be empty for this type of cut. An undefined cut will only be produced if a left cut or right cut was produced, and there was a part left over after cutting or a cut is bounded to the left and right of the cutter. If an error occurs, NULL is returned.
member.remarks: The cutter and geometry's spatial references must match. Date: 2016-10-12 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The RT_PolylineHandle that will be used to divide the geometry into pieces where they cross the cutter.
The input RT_GeometryHandle to be cut.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeometryEngine.IsSimple(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeometry)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the geometry is simple. For Polylines: the only condition is there can be no degenerate segments. When the polyline has no Z, the degenerate segments are those that have length in xy plane less or equal the tolerance. When the polyline has Z, the degenerate segments are those that are shorter than the tolerance in xy plane, and the change in Z value along the segment is less than or equal to the Z tolerance. For Polygons: Exterior rings are clockwise, and holes are counterclockwise. Rings can touch other rings in finite number of points. Rings can be self tangent in finite number of points. Vertices are either exactly coincident, or further than the Spatial_reference tolerance from each other. If a vertex is not equal to any boundary point of a segment, it has to be further than tolerance from any segment. No segment length is zero or less than tolerance. Each path contains at least three non-equal vertices. No empty paths allowed. Order of rings does not matter.
member.remarks: Point geometry is always simple. For Multi_point: there can be no point with exactly equal x and y - the tolerance is not taken into account. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.param: The azimuth angle of the direction for the points.
The angular unit of measure for azimuth. If null, degrees will be used.
The type of curve to calculate.
The distance to move the points.

A RT_VectorHandle of RT_ElementType_geometry (points). Contents of the vector are copied.

member.summary: Creates an offset version of the input geometry.
member.remarks: The offset operation creates a geometry that is a constant distance from the input geometry. If is similar to buffering, but produces a one sided result. If distance > 0, then the offset geometry is constructed to the right of the input geometry, otherwise it is constructed to the left. The caller owns the returned memory and can clean it up by calling RT_Geometry_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The ratio used to produce a bevel join instead of a miter join (used only when the offset type is Miter).
The offset distance for the new geometry.
The maximum distance of the resulting segments compared to the true circular arc (used only when the offset type if round).
The offset type the resulting geometry.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoprocessingFeatures
member.summary: A handle to geoprocessing features used as input or output parameters.
member.remarks:
When RT_GeoprocessingFeatures_getFeatures are returned as an output parameter the returned results are provided as a read-only list of RT_FeatureHandle using RT_GeoprocessingFeatureSetHandle. These features can be visualized on a map using temporary RT_GraphicHandle on a RT_GraphicsOverlayHandle or using RT_FeatureCollectionTableHandle on a RT_FeatureCollectionLayerHandle. If used geoprocessing service is configured to use a result map server, then RT_GeoprocessingResult_getMapImageLayer was populated and it can be used to visualize the results using the symbology predefined by the service.
When providing RT_GeoprocessingFeaturesHandle as an input to the geoprocessing task, features can be provided directly from the RT_FeatureQueryResultHandle that was returned from the RT_FeatureTableHandle. If there is a need to create a new set a features or records, RT_FeatureCollectionTableHandle can be used.
You need to pass this handle to all geoprocessing features parameter functions. Each handle must be destroyed by passing it to RT_GeoprocessingParameter_destroy.Corresponds to GPRecordSet and GPFeatureRecordSetLayer parameter types on the service. A feature contains a RT_GeoprocessingFeatures_getFeatures and may contains extra attributes on RT_GeoElement_getAttributes collection. A record (or a row) doesn't contain RT_FeatureHandle and information is stored in attributes on RT_GeoElement_getAttributes collection. Date: 2016-10-26 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoprocessingFeatures.URL
member.summary: Gets the input url that will be sent to the geoprocessing service to retrieve features.
member.remarks: The url is for input parameters only. For output parameters this is empty. For input it must be a url that is accessible to the geoprocessing service so it can retrieve the feature set. If this property is set, it will override the RT_GeoprocessingFeatures_getFeatures property. Date: 2016-09-29 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoprocessingFeatures.CanFetchOutputFeatures
member.summary: Indicates if features can be fetched from the service of an output parameter.
member.remarks: This property applies to output parameters. It indicates the parameter is an output parameter that can fetch features from the geoprocessing service. Depending on the type of the service the RT_GeoprocessingFeatures_getFeatures may already be available. If features are not present then this property indicates that you can use RT_GeoprocessingFeatures_fetchOutputFeaturesAsync to request features and asynchronously update the RT_GeoprocessingFeatures_getFeatures property. Date: 2016-09-29 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoprocessingFeatures.Features
member.summary: Gets the features that are sent to or returned from the geoprocessing service.
member.remarks: For an input parameter, this contains features to be sent to the geoprocessing service. This property will be ignored if RT_GeoprocessingFeatures_setURL is set. For an output parameter, this can contain features returned from a geoprocessing service depending on the service configuration. It can be null for services that have a map service, in which case calling RT_GeoprocessingFeatures_fetchOutputFeaturesAsync will retrieve the features from the service. Date: 2016-09-15 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoprocessingLinearUnit
member.summary: A linear unit input or output parameter.
member.remarks:
When a RT_GeoprocessingLinearUnitHandle parameter is created with one of the supported RT_GeoprocessingLinearUnits the value is sent to the service using defined linear unit type.
When a RT_GeoprocessingLinearUnitHandle parameter is created with a RT_LinearUnitHandle, the value is converted to meters if the type is not supported. For example if provided RT_LinearUnitHandle is international miles, the value is converted to meters since only the US Survey Miles unit is supported in geoprocessing. After RT_GeoprocessingLinearUnitHandle is created, the used linear unit type can be checked from RT_GeoprocessingLinearUnit_getLinearUnit.
When RT_GeoprocessingLinearUnitHandle is created with a supported RT_LinearUnitHandle, then no conversion takes place and the value is sent to the service using the defined type.
When RT_GeoprocessingLinearUnitHandle is returned as a output parameter, you can get RT_LinearUnitHandle using RT_GeoprocessingLinearUnit_getLinearUnit/> method.
You need to pass this handle to all geoprocessing linear unit parameter functions. Each handle must be destroyed by passing it to RT_GeoprocessingParameter_destroy.Corresponds to GPLinearUnit parameter type on the service. Geoprocessing tasks support a set of linear units defined in the RT_GeoprocessingLinearUnits. Date: 2016-10-26 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoprocessingParameters
member.summary: Geoprocessing parameters contains input parameters that are sent to the target geoprocessing task.
member.remarks: GeoprocessingParameters contains both input parameters and environment variables that are used in the target geoprocessing task. At a minimum all parameters that are set as required on the published task must to be provided to run the task successfully. Parameters that have default values can be overridden by providing a new value in the inputs dictionary. Optional parameters can be provided the same way. You need to pass this handle to all geoprocessing input parameters functions. Each handle must be destroyed by passing it to RT_GeoprocessingParameters_destroy. Date: 2016-10-26 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoprocessingResult
member.summary: Contains output parameters returned from the service.
member.remarks: You need to pass this handle to all geoprocessing result collection functions. Each handle must be destroyed by passing it to RT_GeoprocessingResult_destroy.Single output parameters can be found from RT_GeoprocessingResult_getOutputs dictionary where the key of the item is the name of the output parameters and the value is the returned RT_GeoprocessingParameterHandle. If used geoprocessing service is configured to use result map server then RT_GeoprocessingResult_getMapImageLayer might be populated. RT_GeoprocessingResult_getMapImageLayer is a dynamic map service that accompanies a geoprocessing service to visualize the geoprocessing results. Each geodataset output parameter of a geoprocessing task will be added as a layer to a map service. The visualization of the layer is determined by the symbology on geoprocessing service. RT_GeoprocessingResult_getMapImageLayer are mainly used to visualize RT_GeoprocessingRasterHandle or RT_GeoprocessingFeaturesHandle but in some cases RT_GeoprocessingStringHandle is used as a reference to a geodataset which is added to the result map service as a layer. Date: 2016-10-26 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoprocessingTask
member.summary: GeoprocessingTask is used to run geoprocessing task that is published as a web service.
member.remarks: GeoprocessingTask is the main component when running geoprocessing tasks. The task might be published through ArcGIS Server or Local server (on the platforms that supports it) using either synchronous execute or asynchronous submit execution type. When RT_GeoprocessingParametersHandle is created it is important to match RT_GeoprocessingExecutionType to the value on the service. You need to pass this handle to all geoprocessing task functions. Each handle must be destroyed by passing it to RT_GeoprocessingTask_destroy. Date: 2016-10-26 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoView
member.summary: GeoView is a base class for MapView and SceneView, these represent the View in an Model View Controller (MVC) architecture, the Map and Scene that are set on these views represent the model.
member.remarks: It contains all of the common operations and events that apply to displaying and working with Maps and Scenes. This includes changing what is viewable area by setting a viewpoint, responding to viewpoint change events, working with graphics overlays and identifying elements that displayed at a given location in the view. member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoView.IdentifyGraphicsOverlay(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGraphicsOverlay,RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreCoordinate2D,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initiate an Identify operation on the specified graphics overlay. This overload will return the visible topmost graphic. The 'return_popups_only' parameter controls what properties are populated in the RT_IdentifyGraphicsOverlayResultHandle instance that is returned by the identify operation. true: only the 'popups' property will be populated with results. If the overlay does not have popups an error will be returned. false: the 'graphics' property will be populated, and the 'popups' property will be populated if the overlay has popups. C_API INTERNAL ONLY: this function supports performing identify on the RT_GeoViewHandle's sketch overlay.
member.remarks: The 'tolerance' parameter determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. Any graphics that intersect this test region when rendered are returned, up to the maximum_results limit. A tolerance of 0 tests just the physical pixel at screen_point. Tolerance values above 0 are in DIPs and specify a circular region centered on screen_point, with radius equal to tolerance. The maximum allowed tolerance value is 100 DIPs, resulting in an identify circle of diameter 200 DIPs. Date: 2016-10-04 Non-overloaded method: IdentifyGraphicsOverlay Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The overlay on which to run the identify.
Controls whether the graphics property of the result is populated.
The location at which to run identify in screen coordinates.
Determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. See remarks for further detail.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoView.IdentifyGraphicsOverlay(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGraphicsOverlay,RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreCoordinate2D,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initiate an Identify operation on the specified graphics overlay. The 'return_popups_only' parameter controls what properties are populated in the RT_IdentifyGraphicsOverlayResultHandle instance that is returned by the identify operation. true: only the 'popups' property will be populated with results. If the overlay does not have popups an error will be returned. false: the 'graphics' property will be populated, and the 'popups' property will be populated if the overlay has popups. C_API INTERNAL ONLY: this function supports performing identify on the RT_GeoViewHandle's sketch overlay.
member.remarks: The 'tolerance' parameter determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. Any graphics that intersect this test region when rendered are returned, up to the maximum_results limit. A tolerance of 0 tests just the physical pixel at screen_point. Tolerance values above 0 are in DIPs and specify a circular region centered on screen_point, with radius equal to tolerance. The maximum allowed tolerance value is 100 DIPs, resulting in an identify circle of diameter 200 DIPs. Date: 2016-10-04 Non-overloaded method: IdentifyGraphicsOverlayWithMaxResults Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The overlay on which to run the identify.
The maximum size of the result set of RT_GraphicHandle to return.
Controls whether the graphics property of the result is populated.
The location at which to run identify in screen coordinates.
Determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. See remarks for further detail.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoView.IdentifyGraphicsOverlays(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreCoordinate2D,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initiate an Identify operation on all graphics overlays. This overload will return the single visible topmost graphic per overlay only. The 'tolerance' parameter determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. Any graphics that intersect this test region when rendered are returned, up to the maximum_results limit. A tolerance of 0 tests just the physical pixel at screen_point. Tolerance values above 0 are in DIPs and specify a circular region centered on screen_point, with radius equal to tolerance. The maximum allowed tolerance value is 100 DIPs, resulting in an identify circle of diameter 200 DIPs. The 'return_popups_only' parameter controls what properties are populated in the RT_IdentifyGraphicsOverlayResultHandle instances that are returned by the identify operation. true: only popups properties will be populated. Overlays without popups will be omitted. false: graphics properties will be populated. Overlays with popups will also return popups.
member.remarks: Results are returned in top-to-bottom order. Date: 2016-10-04 Non-overloaded method: IdentifyGraphicsOverlays Since: 100.0.0
member.param: Controls whether the graphics property of the results are populated.
The location on which to run identify in screen coordinates.
Determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. See remarks for further detail.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoView.IdentifyGraphicsOverlays(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreCoordinate2D,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initiate an Identify operation on all graphics overlays. The 'tolerance' parameter determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. Any graphics that intersect this test region when rendered are returned, up to the maximum_results limit. A tolerance of 0 tests just the physical pixel at screen_point. Tolerance values above 0 are in DIPs and specify a circular region centered on screen_point, with radius equal to tolerance. The maximum allowed tolerance value is 100 DIPs, resulting in an identify circle of diameter 200 DIPs. The 'return_popups_only' parameter controls what properties are populated in the RT_IdentifyGraphicsOverlayResultHandle instances that are returned by the identify operation. true: only popups properties will be populated. Overlays without popups will be omitted. false: graphics properties will be populated. Overlays with popups will also return popups.
member.remarks: Results are returned in top-to-bottom order. Date: 2016-10-04 Non-overloaded method: IdentifyGraphicsOverlaysWithMaxResults Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The maximum number of graphics to return per overlay.
Controls whether the graphics property of the results are populated.
The location on which to run identify in screen coordinates.
Determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. See remarks for further detail.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoView.IdentifyLayer(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLayer,RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreCoordinate2D,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initiate an Identify operation on the specified layer. This overload will return the single visible topmost geolement only per layer or sublayer. The 'return_popups_only' parameter controls what properties are populated in the RT_IdentifyLayerResultHandle instance that is returned by the identify operation. true: only the 'popups' property will be populated with results. If the layer does not have popups an error will be returned. false: the 'geoElements' property will be poplated. The 'popups' property will be populated if the layer has popups.
member.remarks: The 'tolerance' parameter determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. Any Geo-elements that intersect this test region when rendered are returned, up to the maximum_results limit. A tolerance of 0 tests just the physical pixel at screen_point. Tolerance values above 0 are in DIPs and specify a circular region centered on screen_point, with radius equal to tolerance. The maximum allowed tolerance value is 100 DIPs, resulting in an identify circle of diameter 200 DIPs. Date: 2016-10-04 Non-overloaded method: IdentifyLayer Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The layer on which to run the identify.
Controls whether the geoElements property of the result is populated.
The location at which to run identify in screen coordinates.
Determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. See remarks for further detail.

If the layer does not have popups an error will be returned. false: the 'geoElements' property will be poplated. The 'popups' property will be populated if the layer has popups.

Any Geo-elements that intersect this test region when rendered are returned, up to the maximum_results limit. A tolerance of 0 tests just the physical pixel at screen_point. Tolerance values above 0 are in DIPs and specify a circular region centered on screen_point, with radius equal to tolerance. member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeoView.IdentifyLayers(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreCoordinate2D,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initiate an Identify operation on all layers in the view. This overload will return the single visible topmost geoelement per layer or sublayer only. The 'tolerance' parameter determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. Any Geo-elements that intersect this test region when rendered are returned, up to the maximum_results limit. A tolerance of 0 tests just the physical pixel at screen_point. Tolerance values above 0 are in DIPs and specify a circular region centered on screen_point, with radius equal to tolerance. The maximum allowed tolerance value is 100 DIPs, resulting in an identify circle of diameter 200 DIPs. The 'return_popups_only' parameter controls what properties are populated in the RT_IdentifyLayerResultHandle instances that are returned by the identify operation. true: each result's popups property will be populated with results. Layers without popups will be omitted. false: geoElements will be populated. Layers with popups will also return popups.
member.remarks: Results are returned in top-to-bottom order. Date: 2016-10-04 Non-overloaded method: IdentifyLayers Since: 100.0.0
member.param: Controls whether the geoElements property of the results are populated.
The location on which to run identify in screen coordinates.
Determines the extent of the region used during the identify operation. See remarks for further detail.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGraphicsHardwareResources.Recycle
member.summary: Give the graphics resources back to the device. This will decrease the amount of memory used. It will take time to resume and recreate the graphics resources. This is useful when the application is in the background.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGraphicsHardwareResources.Save
member.summary: Continue to keep the graphic resources. This will keep memory at the current level. Resume will be faster because the graphic resources will not have to be recreated. This is useful when the application is pausing the map view and will return to it quickly.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGraphicsOverlay.Extent
member.summary: Calculate and return the extent of the graphics contained in the overlay's graphics collection.
member.remarks: The extent's spatial reference is that of the RT_GeoViewHandle that contains the overlay. If the overlay is not in a view, returns NULL. If the overlay is in a view but that view does not yet have a spatial reference, returns NULL. If the overlay is in a view with a spatial reference, but has no graphics, then an empty envelope will be returned. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Get the graphics collection. An observable vector of RT_ElementType_graphic.
member.remarks: The graphics property is initially set (not NULL). Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGrid
member.summary: Grid is a base class for MGRSGrid, USNGGrid, UTMGrid and LatitudeLongitudeGrid that represents the display of a coordinate system grid on the map view.
member.remarks: It contains all of the common operations and properties that apply to displaying and working with the different grids currently supported. This includes toggling visibility and configuring layout and appearance preferences. This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Grid_destroy. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreIncident
member.summary: A class that represents an incident.
member.remarks: Incidents also represent locations that can serve as the starting point or ending point of a closest facility analysis, for example, a fire or a traffic accident. The RT_IncidentHandle class contains one of location inputs for the RT_ClosestFacilityTaskHandle. The RT_ClosestFacilityTaskHandle will create a route between facilities and incidents. You need to pass this handle to all RT_IncidentHandle functions. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Incident_destroy. Date: 2016-08-24 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreJob.SetJobChangedCallback(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreCallback_Job_JobChanged)
member.summary: Sets the function that will be called when the running job changes status or messages.
member.remarks: Sets the function that will be called when the job changes. This is sent as the status or messages change as the job progresses. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The function to invoke. pass NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreJob.SetJobDoneCallback(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreCallback_Job_JobDone)
member.summary: Sets the function that will be called when the job is done.
member.remarks: A job is done when it has finished with a result, or failed with an error. Canceling a job will also set an error. Setting the function to NULL after it has already been set will stop the function from being called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The function to invoke when the job is done. Pass NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreJob.SetRequestRequiredCallback(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreCallback_Request_RequestRequired)
member.summary: Callback, called when the job request is required.
member.param: The function to invoke. Can be NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreJob.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the job.
member.remarks: The job is canceled and goes into a failure status RT_JobStatus_failed. Jobs on the server cannot be canceled and are abandoned. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreJob.CheckStatusAsync
member.summary: Initiates a request to check the server status.
member.remarks: The task contains a bool indicating if the check was successful. The task completes after the status has been checked. If the job is polling the server for status and is in a time gap, then calling this method will ensure a request is sent right away. The result can be false if the job is not checking server status for example if the job status is paused or uploading. Date: 2016-09-07 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: When specified for a Container, only one of the Container's items is visible at a time.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreKMLListItemType.CheckOffOnly
member.summary: When specified for a Container or Network Link, prevents all items from being made visible at once. The user can turn everything in the Container or Network Link off but cannot turn everything on at the same time. This setting is useful for Containers or Network Links containing large amounts of data.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreKMLListItemType.CheckHideChildren
member.summary: Use a normal checkbox for visibility but do not display the Container or Network Link's children in the list view. A checkbox allows the user to toggle visibility of the child objects in the viewer.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLatitudeLongitudeGrid
member.summary: A grid consisting of east-west lines of latitude and north-south lines of longitude.
member.remarks:
To display graticules, create a LatitudeLongitudeGrid and set it as the grid property within the MapView.
LatitudeLongitudeGrid extends Grid, adding the label unit property.
This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Grid_destroy.This class represents graticules lines showing parallels of latitude and meridians of longitude for the earth. The position of the graticules are based on the WGS84 ellipsoid, irrespective of the spatial reference used by the map view. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLatitudeLongitudeGrid.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a grid consisting of east-west lines of latitude and north-south lines of longitude (also known as graticules).
member.remarks: The grid is supported in spatial references which are continuously pannable or some polar spatial references. You can check the RT_SpatialReference_getIsPannable property is true on your spatial reference. Examples of continuously pannable spatial references include WGS84 (WKID 4326) and Web Mercator Auxilliary Sphere (WKID 102113, 102100, or 3857). The following polar spatial references are also supported: North pole Azimuthal Equidistant (WKID 102016) North pole gnomic (WKID 102034) North pole lambert equal area (WKID 102017) North pole orthographic (WKID 102035) North pole stereographic (WKID 102018) NSIDE EASE North (WKID 3408) NSIDC Sea Ice polar stereographic north (WKID 3411) WGS 1984 NSIDC Sea Ice Polar Stereographic North (WKID 3413) UPS North (WKID 32661) South pole Azimuthal Equidistant (WKID 102019) South pole gnomic (WKID 102036) South pole lambert equal area (WKID 102020) South pole orthographic (WKID 102037) South pole stereographic (WKID 102021) NSIDE EASE South (WKID 3409) NSIDC Sea Ice polar stereographic South (WKID 3412) UPS South (WKID 32761) WGS1984 Antartic polar stereographic (WKID 3031) Date: 2016-09-27 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_Grid_destroy on the returned value.
member.returns: A LatitudeLongitudeGrid instance. This is passed to Grid and LatitudeLongitudeGrid functions. Returns NULL on error.

member.summary: Returns the format used for labeling the grid.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLayerViewStatus
member.summary: The different layer status in the Geo view.
member.remarks: This status is used typically for determining if a layer is displaying or not, with more details why, in a view. The layer view status is a flags enumeration, meaning a layer can have multiple states. It could for instance be both RT_LayerViewStatus_notVisible and RT_LayerViewStatus_outOfScale, or RT_LayerViewStatus_notVisible and RT_LayerViewStatus_loading. This means your layer list in a table of contents (TOCs) could use the status to both determine whether to gray out the layer, and also show a spinning loading icon. However a layer status of RT_LayerViewStatus_active is exclusive and will never be reported together with other statuses. For instance it can't both be RT_LayerViewStatus_active and RT_LayerViewStatus_notVisible. It's important to note that the benefit here over just checking layer visibility and scale ranges, is that also parent layers are taken into account - i.e. if the group layer is out of scale range or off. This greatly simplifies the code needed for building table TOCs that update with the map view. Date: 2016-10-10 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLayerViewStatus.Active
member.summary: = 1, The layer in the view is active. Is exclusive and will never be reported together with other statuses.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLayerViewStatus.NotVisible
member.summary: = 2, The layer in the view is not visible.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLayerViewStatus.OutOfScale
member.summary: = 4, The layer in the view is out of scale.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLayerViewStatus.Loading
member.summary: = 8, The layer in the view is loading.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLayerViewStatus.Error
member.summary: = 16, The layer in the view has an error.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLinearUnitId
member.summary: Defines a list of the most commonly-used units of linear measurement.
member.remarks: These values can be used to create instances RT_UnitHandle, as an alternative to using well-known IDs (WKIDs). In addition to the units in this enumeration, you can also use less commonly-used units, by passing a WKID of a linear unit to the inherited RT_Unit_fromUnitId factory method. The function RT_Unit_getUnitId returns the WKID of the unit. Date: 2016-10-03 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLocationDisplayAutoPanMode
member.summary: How the map view extent is changed due to the current location change.
member.remarks: How the map view extent is changed due to the current location change. Date: 2016-10-10 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLocationDisplayAutoPanMode.Off
member.summary: The location symbol is shown at the current location but the map view extent is unaffected, no auto-panning is performed

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLocationDisplayAutoPanMode.Recenter
member.summary: Centers the map view at the current location, and shows the location symbol. When the current location changes, the map view is automatically panned to re-center at the new location. Behaviour is affected by the wander extent factor.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLocationDisplayAutoPanMode.Navigation
member.summary: Pans the map view so that the current location symbol is shown near the bottom of the map view, and rotates the map view to align it with the direction of travel. When the current location or direction of travel changes the map view is automatically panned and rotated to maintain this position. To use this mode effectively, the device location must be moving at a speed greater than 0 meters per second. Behaviour is affected by the navigation point height factor.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreLocationDisplayAutoPanMode.CompassNavigation
member.summary: Centers the map view at the current location, rotates the map view to align with the direction in which the device is currently, and shows the location symbol. When the current location or position of the device changes, the map view is automatically panned and rotated to maintain this position, thus if the device is spun in a circle, the map view stays aligned with the real world.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreMap.Load
member.summary: Load the map.
member.remarks: Load the map. A map is loaded if it has a spatial reference, an initial viewpoint and all the layer types are know. The layer will be loaded to get the min scale and max scale if they are not already provided. Load will only try loading the object if the load status is RT_LoadStatus_notLoaded. If the object is not in the RT_LoadStatus_notLoaded state the object will do nothing and the RT_Loadable_doneLoading_fn function will be called. member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreMapView
member.summary: A view to render and allow interaction with 2D geographic content from an RT_Map on a screen.
member.remarks:
MapView inherits from GeoView and adds 2D specific methods for map navigation that set the visible area of the map (the current extent) by setting a viewpoint. For example, RT_MapView_setViewpointGeometryAsync zooms the map to the extent of a geometry, and RT_MapView_setViewpointCenterAsync zooms the map to a given scale, centered at the given Point. More setViewpoint methods are available, including overloads where an animation duration can be specified. Geometries passed to these methods will be automatically re-projected if required. Use RT_GeoView_getIsNavigating or a Navigation Changed event to determine if navigation is ongoing or completed. Once navigation is complete, get the new viewpoint from getCurrentViewPoint.
The MapView comes with default gestures to allow users to pan, zoom, and rotate the map specific to each platform. Platforms also allow you to override these gestures with your own. Events are also available on the MapView to allow applications to be notified of gesture events.In a Model View Controller (MVC) architecture, this class represents the View and the Map object represents the Model. To display a map, create a MapView of the required size and then set a Map object. The mapview will automatically load the map, its basemap, operational layers, and display their contents on screen. Date: 2016-08-17 Since: 100.0.0
