member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreMapView.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CorePulseThread)
member.summary: Create a map view for displaying a map.
member.remarks: Creates map view for displaying a map. You need to connect a map to the map view before anything is draw. If using RT_PulseThread_useGeoView you must call RT_GeoView_resume to start the pulse thread which starts the drawing and RT_GeoView_pause to stop the pulse thread. There can only be 1 set of function callbacks for each map view. initialization_completed - Called when map view is ready for you to start interacting with it. draw_requested - Called when map view requires a RT_GeoView_draw to be called. start_drawing - Called when map view starts a new draw phase. Multiple draws can occur after this call but this will not be called again until completed_draw is called. completed_draw - Called when map view is finished drawing in a draw phase. Multiple draws can occur before this call. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_GeoView_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: With RT_PulseThread_useGeoView you must call RT_GeoView_resume and RT_GeoView_pause to control the pulse thread.
member.param: Determines if the map view owns the pulse or not.
The number of pixels per DIP (sometimes referred to as screen density or device pixel ratio).

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreMGRSGrid
member.summary: A class that represents the display of the Military Grid Reference System (MGRS) on the map view.
member.remarks:
MGRSGrid inherits from Grid and adds a property for the label unit to use.
This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Grid_destroy.The military grid reference system is the geocoordinate standard used by various militaries for locating points on the earth. The MGRS grid is derived from the Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) grid system and the universal polar stereographic (UPS) grid system, but uses a different labeling convention. MGRS is used for the entire earth. To display the MGRS grid, create a MGRSGrid and set it as the grid property within the MapView. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreMGRSGrid.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an MGRS grid for displaying on a map view.
member.remarks: The grid is supported in spatial references which are continuously pannable or some polar spatial references. You can check the RT_SpatialReference_getIsPannable property is true on your spatial reference. Examples of continuously pannable spatial references include WGS84 (WKID 4326) and Web Mercator Auxilliary Sphere (WKID 102113, 102100, or 3857). The following polar spatial references are also supported: North pole Azimuthal Equidistant (WKID 102016) North pole gnomic (WKID 102034) North pole lambert equal area (WKID 102017) North pole orthographic (WKID 102035) North pole stereographic (WKID 102018) NSIDE EASE North (WKID 3408) NSIDC Sea Ice polar stereographic north (WKID 3411) WGS 1984 NSIDC Sea Ice Polar Stereographic North (WKID 3413) UPS North (WKID 32661) South pole Azimuthal Equidistant (WKID 102019) South pole gnomic (WKID 102036) South pole lambert equal area (WKID 102020) South pole orthographic (WKID 102037) South pole stereographic (WKID 102021) NSIDE EASE South (WKID 3409) NSIDC Sea Ice polar stereographic South (WKID 3412) UPS South (WKID 32761) WGS1984 Antartic polar stereographic (WKID 3031) Date: 2016-09-27 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_Grid_destroy on the returned value.
member.returns: An MGRSGrid instance. This is passed to Grid and MGRSGrid functions. Returns NULL on error.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreMobileMapPackage
member.summary: A mobile map package.
member.remarks:
MobileMapPackage implements the Loadable interface; the mobile map package contents can be accessed after the mobile map package has loaded.
The version of the mobile map package has a version property which application developers can use to determine if they can be opened in this version of the ArcGIS Runtime SDK. Pre 1.0 packages which were created in ArcGIS Pro 1.1 are not supported, however, they can be loaded so that their version property and item property (including the title and thumbnail only) can be checked. The version of mobile map package from 1.0 onwards follow the semantic versioning scheme. The ArcGIS Runtime will be backwards compatible back to 1.0 mobile map packages and will open the latest supported major version, but will not be able to open future major versions of packages. Please see the system requirements for details on what mobile map package versions are currently supported.A mobile map package is a transport mechanism for mobile maps. It contains metadata about the package (description, thumbnail, etc.), one or more mobile maps, layers, data, and optionally networks and locators. Mobile map packages may contain MobileBasemapLayers. Packages are created in ArcGIS Pro. Mobile map packages are a major part of the offline workflow. Mobile maps inside a mobile map package can be used and programmatically edited (layers can be added or removed). Note, mobile map packages are read-only; edits to mobile maps or layers are not persisted to disk. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreMutablePart
member.summary: Represents a single part of a multipart builder.
member.remarks: Multipart builder is the base class of RT_PolygonBuilderHandle or RT_PolylineBuilderHandle. A part is made up of a collection of segments making the edge of the multipart. Additionally access and modified using the points (vertexes) of segments is available. Adjacent segments which share an end point and a start point are connected and the shared vertex is not duplicated when accessing points. The mutable part can represent gaps between one end point and an adjacent start. However, this is only recommended as a temporary state while modifying a multipart builder, when using RT_GeometryBuilder_toGeometry the gaps are closed with line segments. This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_MutablePart_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreMutablePart.AddPoint(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CorePoint)
member.summary: Add a new point to the end of the part. A new line segment will be added to connect the new point to the previous
member.remarks: The points in the part are the start and end points of segments. A new line segment is added to connect the new point to the previous point. If this is the first point in an empty segment, a single closed segment is added using the same start and end point. Adding a second point will update this line segment to gain a distinct end point. Adding a third or more points will add new line segments. Date: 2016-08-01 Non-overloaded method: AddPoint Since: 100.0.0

member.param: The x coordinate of the new point.

member.summary: Add segment to the end of the part.
member.remarks: A new segment is added to the end. If the start point of the segment matches the previous end point, the segment will share this point. The count of points will increase by 1 if the segment connects, or 2 points if it is disconnected. A more efficient way to add LineSegments to a part is to use one of the addPoint methods. For example RT_MutablePart_addPointXY. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CorePointBarrier
member.summary: A point barrier object is used to restrict route solving.
member.remarks: A class that represents a point location to be avoided (or penalized) by a route. Point_barrier may represent a restricted location to be avoided by a route (e.g., a car accident) or a location at which some additional delay occurs if visited along a route (e.g., a railroad crossing). Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. You need to pass this handle to all point barrier functions. The point barrier class is derived from the graphic class. It must be destroyed by calling RT_PointBarrier_destroy. Date: 2016-08-24 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: A polygon barrier object is used to restrict route solving.
member.remarks: A class that represents a polygon feature to be avoided (or penalized) by a route. Polygon_barrier may represent a regional area of interest within the network to be avoided (i.e., not entered) by a route (e.g., a flood zone) or to penalize/delay a route within any portions of the area traversed by the route (e.g., a busy downtown area or a bad neighborhood). Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. You need to pass this handle to all polygon barrier functions. The polygon barrier class is derived from the graphic class. It must be destroyed by calling RT_PolygonBarrier_destroy. Date: 2016-08-24 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CorePolylineBarrier
member.summary: A polyline barrier is used to restrict route solving.
member.remarks: A class that represents a linear feature to be avoided (or penalized) by a route. Polyline_barrier may represent a linear feature (e.g., a subpath in the network) to be avoided (i.e., not crossed or followed) by a route or to penalize/delay a route along any portions of the feature traversed by the route (e.g., a stretch of interstate with temporarily reduced speed limits due to local construction along an adjacent lane). Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. You need to pass this handle to all polyline barrier functions. The polyline barrier class is derived from the graphic class. It must be destroyed by calling RT_PolylineBarrier_destroy. Date: 2016-08-24 Since: 100.0.0

member.remarks: This function is provided as part of the interface RT_RequestableInterface but is actually not doing anything since a raster is loaded locally without any request. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The function to invoke. Can be NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.summary: Callback invoked when any state of the raster have changed.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRaster.CancelLoad
member.summary: Cancel loading the raster.
member.remarks: Cancels any outstanding requests that the raster has sent. If the raster is in the RT_LoadStatus_loading state then the RT_LoadStatus and RT_ErrorHandle code will be set to RT_LoadStatus_failedToLoad and RT_ErrorType_commonUserCanceled and RT_Loadable_doneLoading_fn will be called. Date: 2016-09-29 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRaster.HandleResponse(System.UInt64,System.Byte[],RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreClientReference)
member.summary: Handles the response to a request for data.
member.remarks: This function is provided as part of the interface RT_RequestableInterface but is actually not doing anything since a raster is loaded locally without any request. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_commonInvalidArgument The request id is for a different object. Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The unique id for the service. Should be 0 if creating the tile cache directly.
The error code associated with the load.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRaster.Load
member.summary: Start the process of getting all the required information.
member.remarks: Loads the raster object. Load will only try loading the object if the load status is RT_LoadStatus_notLoaded. If the object is not in the RT_LoadStatus_notLoaded state the object will do nothing and the RT_Loadable_doneLoading_fn function will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRaster.RetryLoad
member.summary: Retry loading the raster.
member.remarks: Set the load status to not loaded and calls load if the raster is in the failed to load state. Does nothing if the raster is in any other state. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRasterElevationSource.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a raster elevation source object.
member.remarks: A raster elevation source is added to an RT_SurfaceHandle and provides elevation data on which layers may be draped or offset from. The ArcGIS tiled elevation source uses a vector of type RT_ElementType_string with raster files to provide the elevation data. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_ElevationSource_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-09-27 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_ElevationSource_destroy on the return value.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRasterElevationSource.#ctor(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreVector)
member.summary: Creates a raster elevation source using a vector of type RT_ElementType_string with file paths of raster elevation files.
member.remarks: A raster elevation source is added to an RT_SurfaceHandle and provides elevation data on which layers may be draped or offset from. The ArcGIS tiled elevation source uses a list of raster files to provide the elevation data. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_ElevationSource_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-10-19 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_ElevationSource_destroy on the return value.
member.param: The list of file paths of raster elevation sources

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRoute
member.summary: A route object contains information about single route.
member.remarks: A class that contains the output from a route task for a single route. The route contains all necessary output from a successfully- completed route task solve. This includes the cost, shape, and additional metadata specific to the resulting route solution (e.g., route directions, local start/end time, etc.). Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. You need to pass this handle to all route functions. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Route_destroy. Date: 2016-08-24 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRouteParameters
member.summary: A route parameters object contains parameters for route calculation.

The Route_parameters class contains all inputs for the Route_task, as well as settings such as the impedance attribute, accumulate and restriction attributes, backtrack (u-turn) policy, etc. Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRouteResult
member.summary: A route result object contains output of route task's solve.
member.remarks: A class that contains the output results from a route task. The route result contains all necessary output from a successfully- completed route task solve. This includes collection of routes, barriers and messages. Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. You need to pass this handle to all route result functions. It must be destroyed by calling RT_RouteResult_destroy. Date: 2016-08-24 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRouteTask
member.summary: A route task object is used for calculation route by specified parameters.
member.remarks: A class that implements the route task. The route task class uses a transportation network to create a route between multiple stops. The route generated and the results returned honor the settings provided by a route settings object. Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. You need to pass this handle to all route task functions. It must be destroyed by calling RT_RouteTask_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Imports route parameters from feature collection and then adjusts imported parameters to current Route task.
member.remarks: Travel mode would be NULL if it could not be created from the route layer settings for the route task's network. In case if travel mode is NULL then client can override it by another travel mode (for example obtained from RT_RouteTaskInfoHandle). Accumulate attributes from Route Info table going to be applied only if they exist in transportation network restriction and cost attributes. Date: 2016-10-19 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreRouteTracker.EnableLogging(System.String)
member.summary: *Internal Use* Enables logging functionality of route tracker.
member.remarks: Route tracker's logger allows to collect information about route tracker state and GPS location. Logger creates the following files: YYYY-mm-DDTHH-MM-SS_GPS.log for input GPS data. YYYY-mm-DDTHH-MM-SS_STOPS.log for stop and route parameters. YYYY-mm-DDTHH-MM-SS_TRACK.log for snapshot of the tracking result for each RT_RouteTracker_trackLocation. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.remarks: Tracker will start route calculation when it is necessary. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_commonInvalidArgument Invalid argument exception. RT_ErrorType_commonIllegalState Where route tracker is not initialized. Since: 100.0.0
member.param: A curb approach of departure stop for rerouting (either side by default).

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreScene.CancelLoad
member.summary: Cancel loading the scene.
member.remarks: Cancels any outstanding requests that the scene has sent. If the scene is in the RT_LoadStatus_loading state then the RT_LoadStatus and RT_ErrorHandle will be set to RT_LoadStatus_failedToLoad and RT_ErrorType_commonUserCanceled and RT_Loadable_doneLoading_fn will be called. Date: 2016-09-29 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreScene.Load
member.summary: Load the scene.
member.remarks: Load the scene. The layer will be loaded to get the min scale and max scale if they are not already provided. Load will only try loading the object if the load status is RT_LoadStatus_notLoaded. If the object is not in the RT_LoadStatus_notLoaded state the object will do nothing and the RT_Loadable_doneLoading_fn function will be called. This may call the load requested callback and the done loading. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreScene.RetryLoad
member.summary: Retry loading the scene.
member.remarks: Set the load status to not loaded and calls load if the basemap is in the failed to load state. Does nothing if the basemap is in any other state. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSceneView.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CorePulseThread)
member.summary: Create a scene view for displaying a scene.
member.remarks: Creates scene view for displaying a scene. You need to connect a scene to the scene view before anything is draw. If using RT_PulseThread_useGeoView you must call RT_GeoView_resume to start the pulse thread which starts the drawing and RT_GeoView_pause to stop the pulse thread. There can only be 1 set of function callbacks for each scene view. initialization_completed - Called when scene view is ready for you to start interacting with it. draw_requested - Called when scene view requires a RT_GeoView_draw to be called. start_drawing - Called when scene view starts a new draw phase. Multiple draws can occur after this call but this will not be called again until completed_draw is called. completed_draw - Called when scene view is finished drawing in a draw phase. Multiple draws can occur before this call. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_GeoView_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: With RT_PulseThread_useGeoView you must call RT_GeoView_resume and RT_GeoView_pause to control the pulse thread.
member.param: Determines if the scene view owns the pulse or not.
The number of pixels per DIP (sometimes referred to as screen density or device pixel ratio).

member.remarks: Facilities represent locations from which service areas need to be calculated. For example, a fire station can be set as a facility to find which areas it can serve within a 10 minute service area. A hospital can be set as the facility to find what proportion of the population is within a 2 mile driving distance. You need to pass this handle to all service area facility functions. This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_ServiceAreaFacility_destroy. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Called by base class when native object is to be released

member.summary: Releases any callbacks in this class or any derived classes. This is only called by Dispose, not the Finalizer

member.summary: Do not call this method from hand-written code. (may be necessary in hand-written interop code).

member.summary: Creates a service area facility instance with point.
member.remarks: Creates a facility. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_ServiceAreaFacility_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-17 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_commonInvalidArgument You must pass in a geometry to create the service area facility. Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Gets curb approach.
member.remarks: Default value RT_CurbApproach_eitherSide will be returned on error. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaFacility.DistanceToNetworkLocation
member.summary: Gets distance to network location in meters.
member.remarks: The distance to network location in meters can be populated by service area task. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaFacility.Geometry
member.summary: Gets service area facility's point geometry.
member.remarks: Gets service area facility's location using geographical point. Date: 2016-08-17 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaFacility.ImpedanceCutoffs
member.summary: Gets the impedance cutoffs value.
member.remarks: Cutoffs specify the quantity of the impedance to apply. They constrain the extent of the service area to be calculated. For example, if you apply breaks of 5, 10, and 15 when the impedance is set to Time, the service area will include those streets than can be reached within 5, 10, and 15 minutes. The value specified in the impedance cutoffs property overrides the Default Cutoffs analysis setting. If no value for the impedance cutoffs property is specified, service area are generated for the facility based on the Default Cutoffs setting. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaFacility.LocationStatus
member.summary: Gets location status.
member.remarks: Facility location's status can be populated by service area task. Default value RT_LocationStatus_notLocated will be returned on error. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaFacility.Name
member.summary: Gets service area facility's name.
member.remarks: Gets service area facility's name to be reported. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Gets network location.
member.remarks: Gets the service area facility's location on the network that can be populated by service area task. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Gets added cost.
member.remarks: Returns added cost value for given impedance or accumulate attribute. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Sets added cost.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaOverlapGeometry
member.summary: Service area overlap geometry.
member.remarks: Specifies the behavior of service-area output from multiple facilities in relation to one another. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaOverlapGeometry.Overlap
member.summary: Creates individual polygons or sets of lines for each facility. The polygons or lines can overlap each other.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaOverlapGeometry.Dissolve
member.summary: Joins the polygons of multiple facilities that have the same cutoff value into a single polygon. Lines will not overlap each other.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaOverlapGeometry.Split
member.summary: Area is assigned to the closest facility so polygons or lines do not overlap each other.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaParameters
member.summary: A class that describes the service area parameters.
member.remarks: Class holding the parameters of a service area to be solved by RT_ServiceAreaTaskHandle. The default parameters for a RT_ServiceAreaTaskHandle can be retrieved by calling RT_ServiceAreaTask_createDefaultParametersAsync method. You need to pass this handle to all service area parameters functions. This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_ServiceAreaParameters_destroy. Date: 2016-09-12 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaParameters.AccumulateAttributeNames
member.summary: Gets accumulate attribute names.
member.remarks: Gets the accumulate attribute names e.g. "Minutes", "Miles", etc. Accumulate attributes are useful when more information other than the default impedance attribute is required. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaParameters.DefaultImpedanceCutoffs
member.summary: Gets the default cutoff value.
member.remarks: Cutoffs specify the quantity of the impedance to apply. They constrain the extent of the service area to be calculated. For example, if you apply breaks of 5, 10, and 15 when the impedance is set to Time, the service area will include those streets than can be reached within 5, 10, and 15 minutes. The cutoffs you specify in the defaultBreaks property are applied to all facilities that don't contain their own cutoffs. Date: 2016-08-17 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaParameters.GeometryAtCutoff
member.summary: Gets geometry at cutoff.
member.remarks: Specifies the behavior of service area output for a single facility when multiple cutoff values are specified. This parameter does not apply to line output. Default value RT_ServiceAreaPolygonCutoffGeometry_rings will be returned on error. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaParameters.GeometryAtOverlap
member.summary: Gets geometry at overlap.
member.remarks: Specifies the behavior of service-area output from multiple facilities in relation to one another. Default value RT_ServiceAreaOverlapGeometry_overlap will be returned on error. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaParameters.OutputSpatialReference
member.summary: Gets output spatial reference.
member.remarks: All route's geometries will be returned in this spatial reference in the even of a successful solve. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaParameters.PolygonBufferDistance
member.summary: Gets polygon buffer distance.
member.remarks: The polygon buffer refers to the distance from the road the service area polygon should extend when no other reachable roads are nearby, similar to a line buffer size. This is useful if the network is very sparse and you don't want the service area to cover large areas where there are no features. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaParameters.PolygonDetail
member.summary: Gets polygon detail.
member.remarks: Specifies the level of detail of the output polygons. If your analysis covers an urban area with a grid-like street network, the difference between generalized and standard polygons will be minimal. However, for mountain and rural roads, the standard and detailed polygons may present significantly more accurate results than generalized polygons. Default value RT_ServiceAreaPolygonDetail_standard will be returned on error. Date: 2016-09-02 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygon
member.summary: A class that describes the single service area polygon.
member.remarks: The service area polygon stores the resultant service area polygon, which cover the area of the network that can be reached within the given time, distance, or other travel-cost cutoff. You need to pass this handle to all service area polygon functions. This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_ServiceAreaPolygon_destroy. Date: 2016-08-17 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygon.FromImpedanceCutoff
member.summary: Gets from impedance cutoff.
member.remarks: A service area polygon's minimal impedance value. For example, an time impedance value of "5 10 15" specifies service areas of 5, 10, and 15 minutes intervals. You can get polygon which covers area from 5 to 10 minutes interval. Date: 2016-08-17 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygon.Geometry
member.summary: Gets service area polygon's geometry.
member.remarks: Gets the geometry for the polygon in case if RT_ServiceAreaParameters_getReturnPolygons is true. Date: 2016-08-17 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygon.ToImpedanceCutoff
member.summary: Gets to impedance cutoff.
member.remarks: A service area polygon's maximal impedance value. For example, an time impedance value of "5 10 15" specifies service areas of 5, 10, and 15 minutes intervals. You can get polygon which covers area from 5 to 10 minutes interval. Date: 2016-08-17 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygonCutoffGeometry
member.summary: Service area polygon cutoff geometry.
member.remarks: Specifies the behavior of service area output for a single facility when multiple cutoff values are specified. This parameter does not apply to line output. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygonCutoffGeometry.Rings
member.summary: Each polygon includes only the area between consecutive cutoff values. It does not include the area between the facility and any smaller cutoffs. For instance, If you create 5- and 10-minute service areas, then the 5-minute service area polygon will include the area reachable in 0-5 minutes, and the 10-minute service area polygon will include the area reachable between 5 and 10 minutes.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygonCutoffGeometry.Disks
member.summary: Each polygon includes the area reachable from the facility up to the cutoff value, including the area reachable within smaller cutoff values. For instance, If you create 5- and 10-minute service areas, then the 10-minute service area polygon will include the area under the 5-minute service area polygon.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygonDetail
member.summary: Service area polygon detail.
member.remarks: Specifies the level of detail of the output polygons. If your analysis covers an urban area with a grid-like street network, the difference between generalized and standard polygons will be minimal. However, for mountain and rural roads, the standard and detailed polygons may present significantly more accurate results than generalized polygons. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygonDetail.Generalized
member.summary: Creates generalized polygons using the hierarchy present in the network data source in order to produce results quickly.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygonDetail.Standard
member.summary: Creates polygons with a standard level of detail. This is the default.

member.name: F:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaPolygonDetail.High
member.summary: Creates polygons with a higher level of detail for applications in which very precise results are important.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaResult
member.summary: A class that describes the service area result.
member.remarks: The result from RT_ServiceAreaTask_solveServiceAreaAsync operation. A Service area result object represents the results of the operation. It can contains the following (if you enabled returning corresponding property on parameters): An array of polygons and/or lines representing the service areas. An array of graphics representing the facilities used in the analysis. An arrays of barriers (point, polyline, polygon) You need to pass this handle to all service area result functions. This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_ServiceAreaResult_destroy. Date: 2016-09-07 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTask
member.summary: Instances of this class represent tasks that can compute service areas.
member.remarks: A Service Area task allows you to calculate areas that can be serviced (reached) from a given location. A service area is a region that encompasses all accessible streets, that is, streets that lie within a specified impedance. For instance, the 10-minute service area for a facility includes all the streets that can be reached within 10 minutes from that facility. You need to pass this handle to all service are task functions. This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_ServiceAreaTask_destroy. Date: 2016-09-08 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.DefaultImpedanceCutoffs
member.summary: Gets default impedance cutoffs.
member.remarks: Cutoffs specify the quantity of the impedance to apply. They constrain the extent of the service area to be calculated. For example, if you apply breaks of 5, 10, and 15 when the impedance is set to Time, the service area will include those streets than can be reached within 5, 10, and 15 minutes. Date: 2016-08-17 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.DefaultTravelModeName
member.summary: Gets default travel mode's name.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.GeometryAtCutoff
member.summary: Gets geometry at cutoff.
member.remarks: Specifies the behavior of service area output for a single facility when multiple cutoff values are specified. This parameter does not apply to line output. Default value RT_ServiceAreaPolygonCutoffGeometry_rings will be returned on error. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.GeometryAtOverlap
member.summary: Gets geometry at overlap.
member.remarks: Specifies the behavior of service-area output from multiple facilities in relation to one another. Default value RT_ServiceAreaOverlapGeometry_overlap will be returned on error. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.NetworkName
member.summary: Gets network name.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.OutputSpatialReference
member.summary: Gets output spatial reference.
member.remarks: The spatial reference that will be used for output geometry during service area solving. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.PolygonBufferDistance
member.summary: Gets polygon buffer distance.
member.remarks: The polygon buffer refers to the distance from the road the service area polygon should extend when no other reachable roads are nearby, similar to a line buffer size. This is useful if the network is very sparse and you don't want the service area to cover large areas where there are no features. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.PolygonDetail
member.summary: Gets polygon detail.
member.remarks: Specifies the level of detail of the output polygons. If your analysis covers an urban area with a grid-like street network, the difference between generalized and standard polygons will be minimal. However, for mountain and rural roads, the standard and detailed polygons may present significantly more accurate results than generalized polygons. Default value RT_ServiceAreaPolygonDetail_standard will be returned on error. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.RestrictionAttributes
member.summary: Gets restriction attributes.
member.remarks: Gets the names of set restriction attributes e.g. "Oneway". Key in the result dictionary is name of restriction attribute. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.ReturnPolygons
member.summary: Gets return polygons.
member.remarks: Specifies the type of output to be generated. Service area output will contain polygon features encompassing reachable area(s). Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceAreaTaskInfo.ReturnPolylines
member.summary: Gets return polylines.
member.remarks: Specifies the type of output to be generated. Service area output will contain line features representing the roads reachable before the cutoffs are exceeded. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreServiceImageTiledLayer
member.summary: A super class for all image tiled layers that fetch map tiles from a remote service.
member.remarks: Allows you to have a custom service image tiled layer. For a given LOD, column and row your custom service image tiled layer will be called to generate a request (RT_ServiceImageTiledLayer_setGenerateRequestCallback). Once you set the request information (RT_ServiceImageTiledLayer_setRequest) then the request will be sent over the network for you Same as a RT_LayerHandle. Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. You need to pass this handle to all service image tiled layer functions. The service image tiled layer class is derived from the image tiled layer class. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Layer_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSolveCondition
member.summary: A struct that represents a warning or error condition returned by a route task solve.
member.remarks: Solve conditions represent exceptional cases (e.g., invalid input, unlocated stops) which must be reported to the client upon completion of the route task solve operation. This includes support for both warning conditions (where the input is ineffective, but valid) and error conditions (where the input is invalid). The code associated with the condition indicates the condition type (see RT_SolveCode enum for details), and the details associated with the condition indicate the objects to which the condition refers (e.g., if the code is RT_SolveCode_stopUnlocated, then the details vector contains the indices of the problematic stop(s) which are unlocated in the input stops vector of the route settings object). You need to pass this handle to all solve condition's functions. It represents an instance of a solve condition. This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_SolveCondition_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSolveCondition.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Constructor to takes ownership of the handle, called from PrivateCreateFromHandle

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSolveCondition.PrivateDestroyHandle(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Called by base class when native object is to be released

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSolveCondition.DisposeCallbacks
member.summary: Releases any callbacks in this class or any derived classes. This is only called by Dispose, not the Finalizer

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSolveCondition.PrivateCreateFromHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Do not call this method from hand-written code. (may be necessary in hand-written interop code).
member.remarks: Creates a CoreSolveCondition class wrapping and owning the native handle. NB: Must not be passed a native handle that is taken from an existing CoreSolveCondition instance.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSolveCondition.GetCode
member.summary: Gets a solve condition code.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSolveCondition.GetDetails
member.summary: Gets solve condition details.
member.remarks: The valid values types for details array: RT_ElementType_int32 if solve condition related with stops or barriers. RT_ElementType_string if solve condition related with invalid accumulative or restriction attributes names. RT_ElementType_attributeParameterValue if solve condition related with attribute parameter values or restriction usage parameters. Combined when first element is RT_ElementType_int32 and second element is RT_ElementType_array. Please look to the RT_SolveCode documentation which describes this case for several solve codes. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSpatialReference.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a spatial reference based on WKID.
member.remarks: The method will create a spatial reference that has only horizontal coordinate system and does not have vertical coordinate system associated with it. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_SpatialReference_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called and NULL will be returned. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_SpatialReference_destroy on the return value.
member.param: The well known ID of the horizontal coordinate system. Must be a positive value.

member.summary: Creates a spatial reference based on well known text.
member.remarks: This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_SpatialReference_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called and NULL will be returned. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_SpatialReference_destroy on the return value.
member.param: The well known text of the spatial reference to create.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSpatialReference.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a spatial reference based on WKID for the horizontal coordinate system and vertical coordinate system.
member.remarks: The method will create a spatial reference that has both horizontal and vertical coordinate systems. When the vertical_WKID is 0, the method is equivalent to calling RT_SpatialReference_create(WKID), and does not define a vertical coordinate system part. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_SpatialReference_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called and NULL will be returned. Date: 2016-08-01 Error Types: RT_ErrorType_unknown Unknown error Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_SpatialReference_destroy on the return value.
member.param: The well known ID of the horizontal coordinate system. Must be a positive value.
The well known ID of the vertical coordinate system. Must be a non negative value.

member.summary: Retrieve the well known id for the horizontal coordinate system.
member.remarks: Retrieves the well known id for the horizontal coordinate system. Will return 0 if an error occurs. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSpatialReference.WKText
member.summary: Retrieve the well known string for the horizontal and vertical coordinate system.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSpatialReference.BaseGeographic
member.summary: If the given spatial reference is a projected coordinate system, then this will return the geographic coordinate system of that system.
member.remarks: If the spatial reference is a projected coordinate system, then a spatial reference object representing the underlying geographic coordinate system is returned. Every projected coordinate system has an underlying geographic coordinate system. If the spatial reference is a geographic coordinate system, then a reference to itself is returned. If the spatial reference is a local spatial reference, a NULL is returned with an error. The returned object must be destroyed by calling function RT_SpatialReference_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called and NULL will be returned. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Retrieve the extent for the spatial reference.
member.remarks: Retrieve the extent for the spatial reference which is a envelope and contains the same spatial reference as the input spatial reference. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_Geometry_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_Geometry_destroy on the return value.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreStop
member.summary: A class that represents a location to be visited along a route.
member.remarks: The Stop class contains location inputs for the Route_task. The Route_task will create a route between two or more Stops. A Stop object is not an arbitrary bag of properties, but contains only the properties needed for routing (for example, a Stop object does not have address information). Stop objects are collected into a vector by value, and passed as an input to Route_task. Changing type just to make it clear you get back a derived type. You need to pass this handle to all stop functions. The stop class is derived from the graphic class. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Stop_destroy. Date: 2016-08-24 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSurface.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a Surface object.
member.remarks: Provides a surface on which layers may be draped or from which relative layers maybe offset. The most common use of the Surface is to represent the ground in a scene. It is comprised of a collection of elevation sources RT_ElevationSourceHandle which are combined in the to generate the surface. If the data from the elevation sources is spatially coincident it will use the elevation source order to determine which source to use. This object must be destroyed by calling function RT_Surface_destroy. If an error occurs the error handler RT_ErrorHandler will be called. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_Surface_destroy on the return value.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSurface.ElevationExaggeration
member.summary: Get the exaggeration for the surface.
member.remarks: Get the exaggeration for the surface. The exaggeration value is a multiplying factor applied to the altitude value of the surface. The default value is 1.0 indicating no exaggeration. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSurface.ElevationSources
member.summary: Retrieve the elevation sources for the surface.
member.remarks: The elevation sources are an ordered collection of elevation source data that are combined to generate a single surface. The order of the elevation sources in the collection indicate which elevation has priority when the sources are spatially coincident. Retrieve the elevation sources for the surface. The collection is specific to this surface. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSurface.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets the "is enabled" state for the surface.
member.remarks: The "is enabled" state indicates if the Surface should rendered. If the surface is enabled is false the none of the elevation sources RT_ElevationSourceHandle it contains are used for rendering. If it is true then the elevation sources own "is enabled" state is used to determine if it is used for rendering. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSymbol
member.summary: A base class to represent symbols.
member.remarks: Symbols describe how graphics look on the map. Different symbols are used for graphics with different geometry types. Marker symbols are used for point and multipoint graphics, Fill symbols are used for polygon graphics, and Line symbols are used for polyline graphics. The handle must be destroyed from RT_Symbol_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSymbol.CreateSwatchAsync(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreColor,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a swatch of the symbol.
member.param: The background color of the swatch. Can be NULL, in which case a transparent background is used.
The number of pixels per DIP (sometimes referred to as screen density or device pixel ratio). NOTE: This parameter should not be exposed publicly.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSymbol.CreateSwatchAsync(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreColor,RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreGeometry)
member.summary: Creates a swatch of the symbol.
member.param: The background color of the swatch. Can be NULL, in which case a transparent background is used.

The geometry of the symbol to be drawn in the swatch image. The specified geometry is in DIPs, with the point {0,0} located at the centerpoint of the swatch image. The X-axis increases towards the right-hand side of the swatch image. The Y-axis increases towards the top of the swatch image. For example: when creating a swatch for a RT_MarkerSymbolHandle, specifying a geometry of {10,10} will draw the marker 10 DIPs up and to the right of the center of the swatch. The geometry type (RT_PointHandle, RT_PolylineHandle, RT_PolygonHandle) should correspond to the symbol type (RT_MarkerSymbolHandle, RT_LineSymbolHandle, RT_FillSymbolHandle). The geometry's spatial reference is ignored.

The number of pixels per DIP (sometimes referred to as screen density or device pixel ratio). This value is used to scale symbology when rendering the swatch. The value should be set appropriately in order to render swatches at the correct scale for a given display. Note: Picture Marker Symbols without a set Width or Height are not scaled by screen_scale, as unset Width and Height are taken to mean "render at native pixel scale".

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSymbolStyle
member.summary: A symbol style object.
member.remarks: You can also use a standalone Symbol style to search for symbol primitives. Symbol primitives are the individual symbols that make up more complex symbols. This is achieved using searchSymbols. You could create a symbol picker app that searches for all symbols that have the tag "maritime" in it. The search results contain symbols which you could then either use as they are or extract from them different individual symbols to create a new composite symbol.You need to pass this handle to all symbol style functions. This object talks to stylx file to generate symbols and search symbols specific to the style file. It must be destroyed by calling RT_SymbolStyle_destroy. When used by itself, the Symbol style supports two key workflows. The first is to find a symbol with provided key values. This is done by creating an array of key fields, and passing those into getSymbol, which returns a new Symbol. In this case, the key is the value associated to the symbol in the stylx file. You might use this symbol to create a new Graphic. Date: 2016-10-04 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreSymbolStyleSearchParameters
member.summary: Search parameters used to search for symbol primitives in a symbol style .
member.remarks: SymbolStyleSearchParameters allow you to specify different parameters when searching a symbol style with RT_SymbolStyle_searchSymbolsAsync. For example, you may want to search for any symbols where the category is "2", the name contains "destroyed", and the tags contain "Protection Lines". You need to pass this handle to all symbol style search parameters functions. This object allows you to set the parameters inorder to perform a search on symbol style . It must be destroyed by calling RT_SymbolStyleSearchParameters_destroy. You can make a copy of this and pass it or reuse it for different search. Date: 2016-10-12 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: A search result object returned by symbol style.
member.remarks: This object is returned by symbol style based on the search performed using search parameters. It contains the information related to name, tags, category, class type, key associated to a symbol. It also returns the symbol. You need to pass this handle to all symbol style search result functions. This object returns the results based on search performed in the symbol style using the search parameters. It must be destroyed by calling RT_SymbolStyleSearchResult_destroy. This returns the symbol and all the parameters associated to it. Date: 2016-10-12 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreTask
member.summary: The Task object.
member.remarks: A task object represents work that can be completed asynchronously, and concurrently with other tasks. It produces a result of type RT_ElementHandle on successful completion. Tasks which return void will produce a result that returns a boolean. A task can be waited upon and canceled independently of other tasks. Completion notification is available through the callback RT_Task_completed_fn. You need to pass this handle to all Task functions. You will get this handle from various functions and the handle must be destroyed from RT_Task_destroy. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreTileCache
member.summary: Metadata for a local cache of pre-rendered map tiles that can be used to create a layer.
member.remarks: Local tile caches are ideal for providing basemaps or less frequently changing contextual layers, where network access is limited or non-existent. They can be created and downloaded onto a device by using an RT_ExportTileCacheJobHandle, or alternatively can be provisioned directly to local storage. The supported types of cache are: Tile package (.tpk) - a map and the tile cache of the data contained within it, packaged into one convenient, portable file, ideal for offline sharing or complete map documents in a disconnected environment or via a portal. Compact Cache - a directory structure where groups of tiles are combined into larger .bundle files, preserving performance and reducing copy times and the size on disk of the cache. Exploded Cache - a directory structure where map tiles are stored as individual files. A TileCache is often used as a basemap, but can also be used to create an RT_ArcGISTiledLayerHandle that is added to a map as an operational layer. Date: 2016-05-25 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreTileInfo.CompressionQuality
member.summary: Returns the compression quality of the tile images. The compression quality controls how much loss the image will be subjected to by the compression algorithm. The values of the pixels of an image compressed with a higher compression quality will be closer to those of the original image. The valid range of compression quality values is from 1 to 100.
member.remarks: If there's an error the return value is -1. Date: 2016-09-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreTileInfo.DPI
member.summary: Returns the DPI (dots per inch) of the tiles.

member.name: P:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreTileInfo.Format
member.summary: Returns the format of the tile images.
member.remarks: If there's an error the return value is RT_TileImageFormat_unknown. Date: 2016-09-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.summary: Returns a list of LevelOfDetail instances. Each one has properties for its particular resolution and scale.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreUSNGGrid
member.summary: A class that represents the display of the United States National Grid (USNG) on the map view.
member.remarks:
USNGGrid inherits from Grid and adds a property for the label unit to use.
This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Grid_destroy.The United States National Grid (USNG) is a point reference system of grid references commonly used in the United States. It provides a nationally consistent language of location in a user friendly format. It is similar in design to the national grid reference systems used throughout other nations. The USNG was developed by the Federal Geographic Data Committee. To display the USNG grid, create a USNGGrid and set it as the grid property within the MapView. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreUSNGGrid.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an USNG grid for displaying on a map view.
member.remarks: The grid is supported in spatial references which are continuously pannable or some polar spatial references. You can check the RT_SpatialReference_getIsPannable property is true on your spatial reference. Examples of continuously pannable spatial references include WGS84 (WKID 4326) and Web Mercator Auxilliary Sphere (WKID 102113, 102100, or 3857). The following polar spatial references are also supported: North pole Azimuthal Equidistant (WKID 102016) North pole gnomic (WKID 102034) North pole lambert equal area (WKID 102017) North pole orthographic (WKID 102035) North pole stereographic (WKID 102018) NSIDE EASE North (WKID 3408) NSIDC Sea Ice polar stereographic north (WKID 3411) WGS 1984 NSIDC Sea Ice Polar Stereographic North (WKID 3413) UPS North (WKID 32661) South pole Azimuthal Equidistant (WKID 102019) South pole gnomic (WKID 102036) South pole lambert equal area (WKID 102020) South pole orthographic (WKID 102037) South pole stereographic (WKID 102021) NSIDE EASE South (WKID 3409) NSIDC Sea Ice polar stereographic South (WKID 3412) UPS South (WKID 32761) WGS1984 Antartic polar stereographic (WKID 3031) Date: 2016-09-27 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_Grid_destroy on the returned value.
member.returns: An USNGGrid instance. This is passed to Grid and USNGGrid functions. Returns NULL on error.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreUTMGrid
member.summary: A class that represents the display of the Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinate system grid on the map view.
member.remarks:
To display the UTM grid, create a UTMGrid and set it as the grid property within the MapView.
This is an opaque handle. It must be destroyed by calling RT_Grid_destroy.The Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) conformal projection uses a 2-dimensional Cartesian coordinate system to give locations on the surface of the Earth. Like the traditional method of latitude and longitude, it is a horizontal position representation, i.e. it is used to identify locations on the Earth independently of vertical position. However, it differs from that method in several respects. The UTM system is not a single map projection. The system instead divides the Earth into sixty zones, each being a six-degree band of longitude, and uses a secant transverse Mercator projection in each zone. Date: 2016-08-30 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreUTMGrid.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a grid for displaying UTM zones on a map view.
member.remarks: The grid is supported in spatial references which are continuously pannable or some polar spatial references. You can check the RT_SpatialReference_getIsPannable property is true on your spatial reference. Examples of continuously pannable spatial references include WGS84 (WKID 4326) and Web Mercator Auxilliary Sphere (WKID 102113, 102100, or 3857). The following polar spatial references are also supported: North pole Azimuthal Equidistant (WKID 102016) North pole gnomic (WKID 102034) North pole lambert equal area (WKID 102017) North pole orthographic (WKID 102035) North pole stereographic (WKID 102018) NSIDE EASE North (WKID 3408) NSIDC Sea Ice polar stereographic north (WKID 3411) WGS 1984 NSIDC Sea Ice Polar Stereographic North (WKID 3413) UPS North (WKID 32661) South pole Azimuthal Equidistant (WKID 102019) South pole gnomic (WKID 102036) South pole lambert equal area (WKID 102020) South pole orthographic (WKID 102037) South pole stereographic (WKID 102021) NSIDE EASE South (WKID 3409) NSIDC Sea Ice polar stereographic South (WKID 3412) UPS South (WKID 32761) WGS1984 Antartic polar stereographic (WKID 3031) Date: 2016-09-27 Since: 100.0.0 Warning: You must call RT_Grid_destroy on the returned value.
member.returns: A UTMGrid instance. This is passed to Grid and UTMGrid functions. Returns NULL on error.

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.CoreVector
member.summary: Defines a dynamic array that provides callbacks when elements are added or removed.
member.remarks: The RT_ElementHandle object can be reused for multiple calls while adding/inserting/updating values within the collection. So you can instantiate one RT_ElementHandle and iteratively change it's value and call add/update/insert on the collection to modify the values of the collection. If the overhead of creating these RT_ElementHandle does become too much for a specific value type, then consider subclassing the collection type and provide "overloaded" methods that would accept that value type directly. This would eliminate the overhead of instantiating these RT_ElementHandle objects.You need to pass this handle to all vector functions. You will get this handle from various functions and the handle must be destroyed from RT_Vector_destroy. The vector holds RT_ElementHandle objects. Use RT_Vector_getValueType to determine what type of RT_ElementHandle objects are being stored in the vector. A RT_ElementHandle that has been retrieved from the vector can be converted to its underlying type by calling (for example) int32_t int_value = RT_Element_getValueAsInt32(element_handle, error_handler); There are a couple of performance optimizations to consider with the generic collection type: Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreJSONSerializable
member.summary: A interface for reading and writing JSON.
member.remarks: This interface will be used when an Object needs to be read or written to JSON. These methods return a specific object and not the interface RT_JSONSerializableInterface. Objects implementing this interface have the ability to persist custom data to the JSON output. This custom data is stored as a RT_DictionaryHandle where the keys are strings that represent properties on the Object, and the values are strings that represent the JSON value for that corresponding property. Any custom data that causes malformed JSON when the Object is persisted will not be included in the JSON output. For example, if a key from the custom data matches a property on the Object and both were written out to JSON, it would result in malformed JSON. So in this example, the key in the custom data causing the malformed JSON would not be persisted. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: T:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreRequestable
member.summary: *Internal Use* A interface for requesting data.
member.remarks: This interface will be used when an Object needs to be request data. This interface should not be exposed publicly. These methods return a specific object and not the interface RT_RequestableInterface. Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreRequestable.SetRequestRequiredCallback(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.ICoreCallback_Request_RequestRequired)
member.summary: Callback, called when the request-able objects set request required.
member.remarks: The function pointer is called when data is required. Retrieving the data should happen on a different thread. Once the data is retrieved RT_Request_handleResponse should be called. If an error occurs while retrieving the data you still need to call RT_Request_handleResponse. If this method is not called on an object, then the global request handler will be used instead (RT_ArcGISRuntimeEnvironment_setRequestRequiredHandler). Some objects may need to wrap their requestable "child" objects to ensure a proper context for requests. A list of objects that may need to do this is available here . Date: 2016-08-01 Since: 100.0.0
member.param: The function to invoke. Can be NULL to disconnect the callback.

member.name: M:RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.Interop.SetCoreErrorHandler(RuntimeCoreNet.GeneratedWrappers.Interop.CoreErrorHandler)
member.summary: Call this during API initialization to ensure there's a managed function to check core errors and throw exceptions if needed.
member.remarks: Notes for the HandleCoreError implementation: If throwErrorOnFailure is true then funciton can throw a managed exception If false, then it'll be in a finalizer or a situation where it's best not to throw, so writing to Debug.WriteLine is good enough. If the CoreError instance is no longer used it should be disposed to save the finalizer from releasing it.
